I borrowed a cane to ease the impact on my knees, which helped, but what this hike really calls for is a pair of tall walking sticks, which I will bring with me next visit.

629337553.name: Not Easy, but soooo worth it
629337553.author: a TripAdvisor user
629337553.reviewBody: The 2km hike isn\u2019t easy. Most people walk as far as they can and then rest and repeat (and there is a lot of repeating). The view is worth the journey so if you are in Cuernavaca then take the extra 40 minute trip to see the temple and town.

623882921.name: Wonderful
623882921.author: a TripAdvisor user
623882921.reviewBody: We went there with our 4 and 8 year olds. Tough trip up, but great experience. Beautiful jungle and view

622229635.name: Steep 2km staircase... TOTALLY WORTH IT!
622229635.author: a TripAdvisor user
622229635.reviewBody:
Climbing starts from paraje Axitla. To get to El Tepozteco you hace to climb a +- 2 km stone, rustic pathway. There are no railings available for most of the climber, so you have to be extra careful. As it is a rustic path made from stones, some of them are somewhat loose, and on rainy season may be slippery, another reason to be careful. It is climbable, though. Even young children & eldery visit the site and make it through the very top! 
The sights are mesmerizing at any point. It is truly a challenging but wonderful experience. On top of that, Tepoztlán is a beautiful town and the food is beyond delicious.

General Information:
Free entrance on Sundays.
$55 MXN from Monday to Saturday
No pets allowed

I recommend:
Wear comfortable shoes, preferably tennis, bring some water, take your time.

Do not recommend:
Nor suitable for babies & small children,or if you have mobility problems.
Going on a Sunday as it gets really crowded.

613874298.name: The best of the valley
613874298.author: a TripAdvisor user
613874298.reviewBody: If you are in Tepoztlan, you have to climb to the piramide. The natural park is wonderful but the way is heavy so if you have problems of mobility don\u00b4t go. Also pets are not allowed to protect the natural fauna of the area.

611233379.name: A hiden wonder of the world
611233379.author: a TripAdvisor user
611233379.reviewBody: It is amazing. A small piramyd on top of a very high mountain where getting there is a chalange by itself. Beutiful sights and amazing vegetation. Highly recommended for hickers and people who like nature.

611153813.name: Tough but great hike
611153813.author: a TripAdvisor user
611153813.reviewBody: Definitely get up and going early to beat the crowds. It had rained the day before so parts Of the trail were slippery. We climbed approximately 1200 feet up in altitude and about 1.6 miles to get to the pyramid. It was worth the hike as the views were pretty amazing from the top of the pyramid. It is a small pyramid  but the experience is worth it.  Just keep going, hike, you will get there.

603083223.name: Nice and quiet place!
603083223.author: a TripAdvisor user
603083223.reviewBody:
We like to visit this place anytime we can. Climbing the Tepozteco is a challenging thing, we enjoy meal and ice cream. 

The only negative thing is to see many cars in streets where they should not be.

591311754.name: Worth the hike!
591311754.author: a TripAdvisor user
591311754.reviewBody: It was definitely a very tiring hike but so worth it when you get to the top. Wear comfy shoes, non slippery, a lot of people kept slipping. Take some water even though there are people selling some at various points. When you get to the top you oh a ticket to get on top of the Tepozteco, so worth it!

591194261.name: Incredible views that pay off the grueling climb
591194261.author: a TripAdvisor user
591194261.reviewBody: Amazing climb up a mountain with incredible view when you reach the top, do make sure that you carry flashlight is you plan to visit during the winter as you could seriously get into trouble if you don\'t, if you visit during summer, you should be ok.

590396883.name: A  1 1/4 hour hike up a well marked trail to an ancient pyramid
590396883.author: a TripAdvisor user
590396883.reviewBody:
I went to this pyramid several times a year in my 30s, 40s and 50s, once in my 60s and stopped going in my 70s (and 80s). You can make it in one hour but take your time to
enjoy the views. At the top you have to pay a few dollars (pesos) to enter the pyramid
area for a fine view of the valley and a walk on the pyramid. You can purchase soft drinks once you arrive.Coming down is a bit dicier (you can't fall up but you can fall down) so take it easy. It's crowded on weekends not weekdays. Unless you have a pyramid where
you live, climb this one when you visit Tepoztlan.

588536332.name: Amazing hike and ancient temple
588536332.author: a TripAdvisor user
588536332.reviewBody: Strenuous hike with breathtaking scenery along the way. Most of the way up is stone stairs. When the clouds clear at the top, you can see the whole town and surrounding mountains. The temple itself is incredible, and you cam even climb up on it. Costs 50 pesos per person at the top. 100% worth the effort, don\'t give up on the hike!

583183387.name: The ultimate workout! Worth the view!
583183387.author: a TripAdvisor user
583183387.reviewBody: The hardest climb I\u2019ve done in (probably) my whole life! But it\u2019s definitely WORTH IT! When you finally reach the top and see the  pyramid and the view you feel soooo goood! Plus, the whole time you are following a forest path which has wonderful sights and bird sounds. WARNING: this is a 2 km (1.24 miles) hike/climb over a path of uneven stones, so bring LOTS OF WATER (you can buy water on your way up, but they will overcharge you) and confortable shoes (preferably sneakers or hiking shoes). Once you reach the very top you have the option of paying to enter the pyramid area, and even though it\u2019s not a big place, I thing it\u2019s worth paying (you already took that long to get there, probably won\u2019t come back, so why not see it). Take your time while going down, your muscles will be tired and shaky. One more thing, don\u2019t go up after 4pm, chances are you will take a long time to climb and they close the very top at 5:30, you don\u2019t wanna get there to realize it\u2019s nos possible to reach it. Anyways, definitely try it! I\u2019m not fit or a person who exercises frequently and I did it!

579646698.name: Historic Tepozteco
579646698.author: a TripAdvisor user
579646698.reviewBody: It\u2019s extremely crowded destination. We got there before noon and there already thousands of people heading to the top to the pyramid.  Neighborhood shops sell local food, snacks, and alcohol. Get there early is better, it can be difficult to find parking, unless you are willing to walk a mile or two to the foothill to hike up the pyramid. The mountain is a bit steep for the hike, also not paved, smooth as a trail. The good thing is, it\u2019s very shady. We had only one hour to go up and come back down because we had to fly back to Los Angeles in the evening. It was a very tiring hike because of it.  I reached only half way and had to stop while two in our group went to the top!  If you make it to the region, don\u2019t miss this. It\u2019s a fun activity with friends.

576336298.name: Beautiful, challenging
576336298.author: a TripAdvisor user
576336298.reviewBody:
The hike to this pyramid was well worth it. We are in pretty decent shape and we made it to the top in under 40 minutes. It's challenging both going up and coming down, so be prepared and take your time if you need to. Wear comfortable shoes and bring water and a snack. 

Since the pyramid is dedicated to the god of pulque, don't forget to bring up some mezcal to drink on top as an offering. 

Tepoztlan the town is cool to hang out in and shop for art pieces and such. We enjoyed both the hike and the town.

575298864.name: A day trip with a lot of activity
575298864.author: a TripAdvisor user
575298864.reviewBody: The visit to the town of Tepoztlan and climbing the hill of Tepozteco can a day trip full of activity. The town of Tepoztlan is about an hour from Mexico city departing from the bus station called Teminal de Sur, there are al least hourly departures, when you get there,  you can go directly to climb the Tepozteco hill, the access is easy or have something light for breakfast on many of small restaurants to serve local fare that is very tasteful. The climb of the hill can take you from an hour or more depending on your fitness, if you go early most of the climb is below the shadow of trees, once you get to the top there is a small ancient temple, the view of the town and valley is beautiful, you can there as long as you want, once you are back in town you can taste the local dishes in one of the many local small restaurants, taste pulque or have a beer if your thirsty, depending on your schedule you can be back in Mexico city around 5 or 6 in the evening. Is a trip worth taking.

567117298.name: Great place
567117298.author: a TripAdvisor user
567117298.reviewBody: I stayed at Tepozteco in January for a wedding. Hotel room was amazing. Views were great. Staff friendly and I felt safe.

566564379.name: Stairway to the Pulque temple
566564379.author: a TripAdvisor user
566564379.reviewBody:
I want to begin this review with an advice. Please disregard all the reviews that say this trip is not worth it because you have to walk a lot or the building at the top is very small and they were expecting something more. Having said this, allow me to explain what the Tepozteco is and what will you find.
The Tepozteco is a hill located in the town of Tepoztlán in Morelos state. At the top of it there is a small temple constructed to honour a minor god called Ometochtli the god of pulque, which name translates to “2 rabbits”. 
The temple is a very small construction, the roof is gone and you will barely see some glyphs on the interior walls (please see the pictures for reference). 
If you’re lucky enough, you’ll find coatis at the top of the hill, a raccoon kind of mammal, I did not see any of them, I think because I hiked at noon, and the weather was very hot.
Besides the temple and the local fauna, you’ll have an amazing view of Tepoztlán from the top of the hill.
To get there you will walk uphill following a stone stair. The path is very well delimited so you just need to follow it. It will take you like one and a half hour to get to the top (more or less). At the end of the road you will need to pay $55 pesos (around 3 dollars) to enter to the archeological site, except on Sundays, when the access is free. Be prepared because they only accept cash.
You will be walking uphill for at least an hour so remember to bring enough water, confortable shoes, and sunscreen. The path is covered with trees that provide shadow during the walk, however at the top there are just a few places to take cover from the sun. It is also recommended to start the walk early in the morning, to avoid the hot weather at noon.
Remember how I started my review? If you do not like long walks, or you are expecting to see a huge ancient city, it is very likely  you will be disappointed of what you will find when you get to the top of the Tepozteco hill, that does not mean the place sucks or is not worth it. On the other hand, if you decide to give it a try your rewards will be a good hike, a great view, ancient ruins and with a bit luck, some local fauna.

566162212.name: A rewarding hiking experience
566162212.author: a TripAdvisor user
566162212.reviewBody: Climbing the Tepozteco is a rewarding spiritual and mental experienc. You will be surrounded by nature while you climb the steps. At the top you will find an original aztec pyramid where you may feel the good energy of the mountain.When you descend you will find the weekend market where you can buy beautiful artisan made objects.

564709248.name: Amazing view, it is a must
564709248.author: a TripAdvisor user
564709248.reviewBody:
Going up to the top of the Tepozteco is a must, once you are there with the amazing view, all the effort of going up is worth it.

There are some important things to be prepared before going up, it is not a easy journey, there are steps in some parts however, most of the time is just walking on rocks so you have to be very careful on where you stand.
I believe it is better to go on the morning or after 3 or 4 pm since the weather is so hot you get more tired because of the hot weather.
Wear comfortable and safe shoes, that's basic

564133575.name: Long way hiking
564133575.author: a TripAdvisor user
564133575.reviewBody: 45 minutes of tough hiking bring you to this pyramid which, despite the beautiful view, doesnt really offer what you were expecting

561898747.name: One of the main reasons to go to Tepoztlan
561898747.author: a TripAdvisor user
561898747.reviewBody: Is a most to go all the way up, it\'s a long step walk but it is worth it, the views once you are at the top are magnificent and also on your way you can rest and listen to various bird sounds as well as some other animals you also can park your car just at the bottom and buy drinks just as well before you start climbing as well as going to the toilet. we went with my lots of members of the family of different ages .... we had a great time shouting and talking to others with echo, it can be a bit long for some kids that are not used to climb. we loved it!

559215598.name: Great hike for all levels of hiker. Be a bit careful
559215598.author: a TripAdvisor user
559215598.reviewBody: This is really a lovely hike. It is quite easy to get to the top using the normal route, but there are dozens of other trails, some of which hidden, once you get there to go behind the temple and up other mountains. There will be no signs and few people so it might be easy to get a bit lost. Id recommend downloading the area on google maps on your phone so you can track your location. Keep in mind that the area suffered a big earthquake in August and September, so don\'t try to climb through narrow canyons or anything like that. It is a bit

557600177.name: Nice hike. Not much in terms of ruins. Nice view.
557600177.author: a TripAdvisor user
557600177.reviewBody: The ruins themselves are not really interesting, but it is a nice hike to get there. Bring water and be ready! \nYou will be able to see some wild life and humans feeding them despite the sign telling you not to.

557434930.name: Tough long hike up steep rocky path stepped in places, incredible views at top
557434930.author: a TripAdvisor user
557434930.reviewBody: Climbed to pyramid on 29th January.  Took water and wore strong shoes after reading reviews here. Well worth the effort felt we earned our meal and drink after

557000183.name: Beautiful!
557000183.author: a TripAdvisor user
557000183.reviewBody: Great view! The hike is tough for someone who is not used to it! Bring water and protect your food from the lil animals at the top ! \n

556380543.name: More difficult than you\'d think
556380543.author: a TripAdvisor user
556380543.reviewBody: This hike is a real slog over rough terrain, so go in the morning and take water. The pyramid isn\'t as interesting as the ones on the Yucatan peninsula or near Oaxaca city or the one north of Mexico City but it\'s still decent to see. A nice day trip by bus from Mexico City.

556211438.name: Tepozatlan
556211438.author: a TripAdvisor user
556211438.reviewBody: Great views, take water, be patient if you go on the weekend, about an hour to get to the temple. The town below is quaint and cultureful, try the pulque.

554241758.name: A nice hike
554241758.author: a TripAdvisor user
554241758.reviewBody: It\u2019s about an hour hike for those in ok shape. It\u2019s steep, so walk slowly. Really wise to bring enough water, good shoes and some chocolate. The view at the top is amazing. And the pyramid at the top reminds you of agent time. It\u2019s a nice place to have a pick nick and relax before defending.

553652360.name: Totally worth it!
553652360.author: a TripAdvisor user
553652360.reviewBody: The hike up from town is a bit of a butt kicker but it\'s absolutely worth it.  It\'s not a hike... its 1200 vertical feet of steps but not steps, mostly rocks.  Still, you go through all that effort - took an hour with kids - and you\'re left with a sense of accomplishment, an amazing view and a chance to visit a nice pyramid and some coati.\n\nWhen you make it back down, you can stop by some a stand and celebrate with a cerveza in an earthenware mug. Fantastic! Would absolutely do it again.

551550088.name: RIVITING EXPERIENCE!
551550088.author: a TripAdvisor user
551550088.reviewBody: We climbed this 1000 + ft mountain to the top of the mystical pyramid! Amazing experience. Hard walk up...easier on the way down. Talk a camera....fantastic photos in every direction friends. No bath rooms so dont drink too much water on the way....It took us 2 hours to climb up- 1 hour at the top exploring and 1 1/2 on the way down. Many people simply went behind a tree if they had to pee ....just like camping...lol. They sell water at the top - I recommend bringing a few protein bars! About 1/4 of the trail is stone stairs and the rest rocks....wear your climbing boots or shoes. WORTH THE CLIMB!!!! ****BEWARE - there are NOOOOOO Guard rails - and at the very top of the Pyramid -back right side - there is NOOOOO FENCE - and a STRAIGHT drop down -about 300 + ft!!!!   So be careful friends!   OVERALL - It was a amazing experience! Also- great eats when you return to home base (and bath rooms) - try the local treat of Triangle shaped tacos...filled with cheese...DELISH!  ...and enjoy friends!

546843163.name: Incredible!
546843163.author: a TripAdvisor user
546843163.reviewBody: What a sight to see from the city itself and while taking the hike to the pyramid. Unfortunately, due to the recent earthquake, the pyramid is closed. However, you can still hike to it.

546801598.name: Loved it
546801598.author: a TripAdvisor user
546801598.reviewBody: This is a really cool site and on a good day is absolutely breathtaking. Unfortunately due to September\u2019s earthquake the actual entry to the temple was closed (you can climb all the way up but once you get to the base of the rock which the temple sits atop of, a high, gated fence stops you from going any further). My friend and I were lucky enough that at the same time we reached the furthest point a legitimate tour guide was there offering to take us to a different point in the mountain which actually looks back on the temple. Francisco (contact details on picture attached) was our terrific guide and explained the meaning and the past in so much detail. The final point was higher than the actual temple and provided a magnificent 360 degree view of the region. It was such a beautiful day we could even see the volcano at Puebla. I would strongly recommend Francisco\u2019s services to anybody. He does not speak any English though which might hinder people who don\u2019t speak Spanish. I was lucky my friend could translate Spanish to English for me which worked well.\n

546704987.name: Very nice for kicking - great views
546704987.author: a TripAdvisor user
546704987.reviewBody: Very nice for kicking - great views, great exercise, Would be a nice place to comeback for sure...the "Pueblo" is nice to visit too...

540062647.name: Pyramid hike
540062647.author: a TripAdvisor user
540062647.reviewBody: Awesome hike with great shopping and food on the way. Be a local and eat like a local in the indigenous market.

535443681.name: Great hike and amazing energy!
535443681.author: a TripAdvisor user
535443681.reviewBody: Hiking was a bit difficult for some in our party as it was a bit muddy however it was worth the effort as the views are magnificent and the energy amazing !

529456582.name: Buena Vista. Muy exercisio
529456582.author: a TripAdvisor user
529456582.reviewBody: Definitely worth the climb.  Lots of photo opportunities (rest stops) on the way up. I have enjoyed this both times that I have been up. The pyramid is not as big as others but the view is phenomenal. We had a park guide give a lecture while we were there. There was also a man with a singing bowl that led us on a meditation and giving gratitude to the earth and our ancestors \nA truly magical experience \n

528998508.name: Closed!?!?
528998508.author: a TripAdvisor user
528998508.reviewBody:
We parked in town and walked half a mile to the trail head.  It is 2.5 km up to the top.  It's a pretty steep, strenuous climb so make sure to dress appropriately and bring water.

Unfortunately, we got to the top to discover that the gate to the pyramid was closed, for the first time, from the earthquake two weeks ago.  
We were very disappointed; they probably could have put a sign at the bottom.

525588235.name: Incredible Hike! Breathtaking views
525588235.author: a TripAdvisor user
525588235.reviewBody: This is a MUST in Tepoztlan! make sure to wear athletic clothes and shoes because you are in for a hike! beautiful hike with nature and end up on top of a pyramid.

516474984.name: A nice way to spend some time outdoors
516474984.author: a TripAdvisor user
516474984.reviewBody: It\'s a nice, relatively demanding hike to get up there. At a good pace it can take 35-45 minutes. You don\'t have to drive to the base either- we walked there from the town. It offers a really nice view of the valley and it is extraordinary to think that they built this thing all the way up there with only primitive means. Enjoy!

510806772.name: Beautiful landscape -- irrelevant piramid
510806772.author: a TripAdvisor user
510806772.reviewBody: The Tepozteco is a simple and small piramid that lies embeddd high up on the north flank of the beautiful valley of Tepoztlan.\nThe hike is realy nice and actually the lowest part is the most attractive.Thus dont go to the top if yu get tired.\nNotethat you dont pay if you return short of the piramid!

506911233.name: Be prepared!
506911233.author: a TripAdvisor user
506911233.reviewBody: Remember you are already at 1700 metres and the climb is another 350 meters .... it doesn\'t sound much but it\'s pretty steep and awkward, even the young fit ones who went running past us ..... had to stop and catch their breath... we passed most of them.... take your time, take water. If you are an experienced Nordic walker this will present no problems and there are plenty of steps for those who need them, but I would not attempt walk in wet conditions...\nOnce at the pyramid the views are spectacular, however, the pyramid is not...pretty small a ruin, but don\'t let that deter you if want the exercise.\nWe enjoyed it...

503302391.name: steep hike, excellent view
503302391.author: a TripAdvisor user
503302391.reviewBody: we were dropped off at the bottom of the hill near the market stalls early in the morning. It was a long steep hike (I\'m not in that good of shape) but we made it! Excellent view from the top. Just be aware that is is very rock and uneven surfaces with no hand rails. Going down was almost harder than going up. I would do it again.\n

499710011.name: Well, nothing else to do in Tepoztlan.
499710011.author: a TripAdvisor user
499710011.reviewBody: This place is great for excercise.  Walking through a beautiful forest and up the mountain for about an hour.  The view from the top is spectacular.  But not really worth that much effort if you expect something more.  There is really nothing up there apart from a small pyramid.  We do a lot of hiking in Chiapas for something more spectacular.  Like I said there is not much else to do in Tepoztlan.  It is a place for people from Mexico City.  Just walking around in town and climbing up Tepozteco hill.  It is extremely crowded for a small hiking track.  We started early but when we came down, it was ridiculously crowded.  Not pleasant.

499219052.name: Climb to the "Piramide del Tepozteco"
499219052.author: a TripAdvisor user
499219052.reviewBody: This is a must. A very rough climb, and you won\'t make it if you are not in good shape, but it\'s definitely a must see area. We strongly recommend you try it.

496959477.name: DO NOT MISS if you\'re in Tepoztlan
496959477.author: a TripAdvisor user
496959477.reviewBody: Great place for a soft hiking.\nClimb the rocky "natural" stairs until the end and enjoy the Tepozteco Pyramid and the charming view of Tepoztlan.\nIts takes between 40 minutes and 2 hours to climb, depending on your physical condition.

483979971.name: HUGE WALK UP
483979971.author: a TripAdvisor user
483979971.reviewBody: We started walking up not realising how far you have to climb to get to the tepozteco.  Tepozteco is not the mountain, it\'s actually the pyramid sitting on top of the mountain.  The views from up there are gorgeous.  It can take up to 1-2 hours to get up there, depending on how fit or not you are, or how many stops you make on the way.  Careful, because at the beginning you will see steps, then they disappear and become stepping stones with are slippery. Specially be careful going down.  I would think twice about taken children who are not used to climbing up there.\nStill, very interesting to see the pyramid and imagine why they would build it all the way up there.

480394781.name: A must do in tepoztlan
480394781.author: a TripAdvisor user
480394781.reviewBody: The hike is quite exhausting and it\'s only possible with sneaker or even hiking shoes as the stones are slippery. We went on a Sunday and it was way to crowded, go on other days or come early. Bring water, it gets so hot! Make sure you hydrate.

476603072.name: Definitively a must do in Tepoztl\u00e1n!
476603072.author: a TripAdvisor user
476603072.reviewBody: Even though the pyramid itself isn\'t really big, the view is worth the effort of getting there! Moreover,  it\'s really fun to climb the mountain. I highly recommend you wear tennis and get there at 9 am (when they open the park) as the later you get there the more people you\'ll find and the road is really tight (it can take you up to 2 hours to get to the pyramid if you run into people). \nThe price is mxn$45 and it\'s free if you have a student or teachers ID.

476137552.name: Teppozteco
476137552.author: a TripAdvisor user
476137552.reviewBody: It seems easier to climb all the way up than you probably think. Get ready for a good hiking. \nThe pyramid is not as big as you probably think but it\'s definitely worth the view. \nAs they say you can fill yourself with good vibes and energy... it\'s definitely worth a shot.

471215355.name: It\'s definitely a hike but worth it for the view
471215355.author: a TripAdvisor user
471215355.reviewBody:
We hadn't planned on doing this hike but after hearing so much about it we decided to give it a go. My sneakers were in Mexico City, but my friend assured me Trip Advisor reviews always exaggerate and that I would be fine in my Birkenstocks....

I wasn't. I wasn't fine. BUT I sucked it up and got to the top of that mountain (and it is a mountain) where the view was 100% worth my bleeding feet and headache from the altitude. The pyramid is cool but pretty small; you're definitely hiking that monster for the view. We also didn't get to see any coatis, but we were up there pretty early! 

SO: Wear sneakers with GRIPS, the way down is pretty slippery even with sneakers (my Nikes would have struggled). Bring water, you can't buy any up there. There are also no bathrooms once you get past the little market place. We're pretty fit, and it took us around 40 minutes to get to the top, not because of my shoes but because we had to stop so many times to keep my heart from beating out of my chest. Also go early, to avoid the crowds. We got some great shots and were at the top by shortly after 10.

468975122.name: The view gets a "4"
468975122.author: a TripAdvisor user
468975122.reviewBody:
As others have mentioned, the climb up can be arduous ... but that depends on your fitness level and, to some extent, your choice of footwear. I was pretty amazed at the lack of forethought in some folks' choice of shoes.

Yes, it takes anywhere from 30 to 90 minutes to get to the top depending on your fitness level. We decided to make a workout of it and did it in 45 minutes (we're well into middle age, though fit enough), though there were those who were decades younger who *ran* up the mountain and made it in significantly less time.  My iPhone showed that it was 106 floors (at 10' per floor measurement) and something on the order of 8,000+ steps to get up to the top.

The path is a combination of built stairs and rough rock trail - the rocks are uneven and have been worn smooth/slick by traffic and time. I was glad to have had my trail runner sandals on for both support and traction.

Take enough water for up and down. There are no bathrooms once you leave the area where the tiendas are and the tienda up top does not sell water.

Go early. We hit the trailhead at about 9:40am on a Sunday and there were already at least a couple of hundred people in front of us. 

Enjoy the views - the pyramid isn't all that great, but the view is delicious!

468934226.name: A beautiful view after a mighty climb
468934226.author: a TripAdvisor user
468934226.reviewBody: The climb to the top of the mountain is an absolute must. The whole experience is beautiful and the view from the top is breathtaking.

462464326.name: Great Views and a nice family hike
462464326.author: a TripAdvisor user
462464326.reviewBody: Overall it was a great family time, a bit demanding but totally worth it. Nice little pyramid at the top and totally worth view of the village and surrounding nature.

461751896.name: Great hike and nice view
461751896.author: a TripAdvisor user
461751896.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the hike up this mountain. It wasn\'t too difficult. Once you get to the top, if you want to go up to the pyramid you need to pay $50. It\'s worth it for the view more than seeing the pyramid which is pretty much in ruins and quite small, so it\'s hard to walk around, particularly as a lot of people are quite selfish and sit down around the edges preventing people from walking around. The ticket also gives you access to the other side which has a different view and also it\'s where the coatis are which are these adorable little racoons. Really one of my favourite things about that spot.

461553413.name: nice climb to Tepozteco
461553413.author: a TripAdvisor user
461553413.reviewBody: We climbed slowly to the pyramid.  The view and pyramid are well worth the effort.  Bring lots of water, and maybe some energy food.

454529091.name: Butt Kicking Climb to Interesting Aztec Temple and Great View
454529091.author: a TripAdvisor user
454529091.reviewBody: The climb to the temple is the equivalent to 120 stories in a sky scaper.  The stones are uneven and the footing slippery when wet.  I am 60 and in just OK shape and it took me 1.5 hours to climb.  Worth it for the views.  My thighs still ache three days later.  SO glad I made it.  Lots of people are on the path and it is an interesting place.

453674822.name: Solo mission well worth it
453674822.author: a TripAdvisor user
453674822.reviewBody: I had a few days to kill in Mexico city so decided to go to Tepozteco. Definitely worth it for a night and to climb to see the pyramid. The ruins themselves aren\'t up to much but the views are stunning. It\'s easily accessible and you can walk from anywhere in the town. There are signs on the main Street. I recommend doing it early before it gets hot!

450855322.name: Great Hike!
450855322.author: a TripAdvisor user
450855322.reviewBody: Beware, it is all stairs so pretty challenging. The way down was far easier than I thought! The weather was nice and warm even in the beginning of January, so bringing water is a must. The hike is mostly under charming vegetation. We met mostly local people and few tourists. Were impressed with a grandma and some children that made the hike! The view from the top is great, the pyramid is nothing to write home about and I did not climb it.

448587089.name: Difficult but great challenge with rewarding views
448587089.author: a TripAdvisor user
448587089.reviewBody: Excellent place surrounded by nature, lots of trees on the way up which makes it easier to climb. The climb can be difficult, but follow your own pace and it should be fine. There were families with children and senior people.

448394008.name: Excellent steep alone hike
448394008.author: a TripAdvisor user
448394008.reviewBody:
It goes from Tepoztlan village at about 1700 meters up to a small pyramid located at the top of the Tepozteco at about 2400 meters.
It's a nice hike inside a sub tropical forest.
Warning: Many stone steps are positioned un evenly, so the path may be slippery, especially for people with no mountain training and small children trying to climb up or down at a higher speed.
It's totally worth the effort. When we reached the top, an awesome view of the village below appeared in front of our eyes. Tender afternoon breeze, an eagle flying above as and many "coaties" greeting is welcome.
You can sit on one of the side walls of the small pyramid on top and enjoy the view just for hours...
And then, when you get back down to the village, you can enjoy a traditional small village Mexican street food or seat and relax at any of the many available restaurants.
Don't miss the special "tepoznieves", local ice cream stores offering some very exotic tastes.
I really recommend this place.

447309042.name: Beautiful View from Ugly and Unimportant Archeological Site
447309042.author: a TripAdvisor user
447309042.reviewBody: An hour hike upwards a steep slope where at the end special mountainous formation and the families of the wild animal Cacomixtle greet you ... The reward for this hike is a wonderful open view, what makes you perhaps stay longer at this place of an insignificant ruin.

446434135.name: worth the hike
446434135.author: a TripAdvisor user
446434135.reviewBody: It can be a pretty arduous ascent for wee ones and those not in shape, and you have to be careful to go when there are other people around with you, so you don\'t have to worry about any (as Trump would put it) \'bad hombres\' trying to relieve you of your wallet, but it is a nice visit and great site (even tho\' they have no idea how to \'preserve\' things here; they actually use cement)

446284884.name: Great hike!
446284884.author: a TripAdvisor user
446284884.reviewBody: We took our time--four hours total and loved chatting with folks during our rest stops. We took walking sticks, snacks in ziplock bags so the coati (raccoon-like scavengers) wouldn\'t go after my pack, 50 pesos each to actually climb onto the pyramid and water. Surprised to have great phone reception at the top. Since there are no bathroom facilities, we limited our water intake til the way down. Celebrated with cervezas and lunch at Axtila -- right at the base of the trail.

445921142.name: Beautiful scenery from the top
445921142.author: a TripAdvisor user
445921142.reviewBody: It is worthwhile to climb up the Teposteco hill in a sunny day (usually most days are full of sunshine due to the mild microclimate of this part of Morelos state) to se the beautiful scenery from the top. There is also a small pyramid which is interesting to see. When climbing up you may find beautiful landscapes to take good pictures. At the top you can buy a lemonade, which is a good reward for your climbing effort. The way to the top is well paved, so you don\u00b4t need any special shoes nor equipment.

442949623.name: Amazing hike!
442949623.author: a TripAdvisor user
442949623.reviewBody: Probably one of the most invigorating hikes in Mexico!\n\nA must see! Be prepared for a workout! This is not a beginners hike.. but a must do! Nothing quite like it..

442943453.name: Spiritually and physically invigorating. Unforgettable, but be prepared for quite a hike up. But so worth it.
442943453.author: a TripAdvisor user
442943453.reviewBody: They say that this is one of three monoliths in Mexico that give you "spiritual energy"- and I believe it!!! At the very least, you will feel invigorated physically from such a hike and the air atop at the pyramid!\n\nBe prepared to swear profusely and be challenged physically - this is no joke! But I promise you will feel an elation and joy at the top and revitalized coming down. This is a magical and special place. Do not bring plastic bags, food or make to much noise that attracts the "tlahuachas"/ coaties.. they will not be fooled and will come after it !

430706225.name: Beautiful
430706225.author: a TripAdvisor user
430706225.reviewBody: Wasn\'t sure about opting to visit here but really glad I did. Was beautiful area and really picturesque.

428025792.name: El Tepozteco
428025792.author: a TripAdvisor user
428025792.reviewBody: Stunningly beautiful. It was a difficult hike at times and a like of stairs but very worthwhile once you reach the pyramid.

418854478.name: Wonderful Hike Straight Up to the Clouds
418854478.author: a TripAdvisor user
418854478.reviewBody: This solitary pyramid is on top of the local mtns in Tepoztlan, El Tepozteco.  I love going for this hike in the morning, before the crowds show up and while the many vendors set up.  Beware the $90 Pesos entry fee at the actual Pyramid.

407080837.name: See reviews of Parque Estatal Sierra de Tepotzotlan and Z. A. El Tepozteco
407080837.author: a TripAdvisor user
407080837.reviewBody: My review and pictures are in Z. A. El Tepozteco. Sorry, I did not realize the hike had been named different things by different travelers. You will also find reviews of Tepotzotl\u00e1n -- the town at the base of the zona arqueol\u00f3gica Tepozteco -- both here and under "Teptozl\u00e1n".

407078347.name: stunningly beautiful -- difficult climb
407078347.author: a TripAdvisor user
407078347.reviewBody:
Tepotzteco was a small temple honoring Tepoztecatl, an Aztec god. The base of this pyramid is at the top of a steep climb from Tepotzlan. Tepotzlan is easily accessible by bus and the climb is a short walk from the town center. You can't miss it --as you walk through town you will see it looming above you.

This is a very steep climb, much of it made of small stairs. You know your own abilities so you know if you can do the climb, bring a child with you, etc. You will find people carrying babies and those from the cities dressed up in pretty clothes. Those of us who are less hardy need hiking shoes or solid sneakers and comfy clothes. 

A few pieces of advice: a) it is very crowded on the weekend, and the more crowded, the more difficult the climb as you'll have to go at other people's pace.  b) Use the bathroom before you climb :).

c) Bring water but do not bring flavored drinks, food, gum, dog treats (yes, a friend of mine had dog treats in her bag!) because as you'll see in one of the photos, there are badgers at the top who will get into your pack and will find whatever you brought even if you do not turn your back on your bag for a moment.  

To get to the archeological site, you will pay a small fee at the top -- at the time of my visit it was something like $50 Pesos, or ~$3USD. It is worth it. 

We were lucky to have arrived just as a professional guide was setting up incense, blowing a conch and praying. When he completed these rituals, he gave a talk about the history and culture of the area. His talk was entirely in Spanish and he used a lot of local slang so if you are relying on your American high school Spanish, you will understand maybe 50% of his talk. In that case, I recommend hiring your own guide before leaving Tepotzlan. You will not find guides for hire on the climb.

406847457.name: Rocky mountain and smlall Pyramid
406847457.author: a TripAdvisor user
406847457.reviewBody: it\'s a hard time to climb the mountain, but the feeling was very good at the top of the mountain.

402594533.name: Tips for getting to and navigating Tepozteco
402594533.author: a TripAdvisor user
402594533.reviewBody:
We went to Tepozteco on a Sunday, arriving around 1:30 in the afternoon. On Sundays, they do not charge an entrance fee. Hence, the climb was extremely crowded - as in there were hundreds of people ahead of us and behind us the entire time. I would strongly suggest that to enjoy the most out of this hike, which climbs up a beautiful, wooded area and ends in ruins overlooking the town of Tepotzlan, to go on a different day of the week, preferably earlier in the morning.

GETTING THERE:
Getting to Tepozteco is very easy from Mexico City. You can take an uber to the bus terminal in Taxqueno and take a Pullman bus straight to Tepotzlan. The bus ride takes about an hour and a half. You can buy the tickets online or buy them in person at the bus stop. You could also try to take a cab or Uber from the city; while we did not end up using this option, when I requested a fare estimate it was projected to be about ~700 pesos. You can also take a bus to the town of Cuernavaca if you want; it's a popular place to visit along with Tepotzlan/Tezpoteco. However, to get from Cuernavaca to Tepotzlan, you will have to ride another bus or take a cab (about ~45-50 min drive). 

Once you arrive in Tepotzlan, it is a very small town with a long main road called 5th Avenue that leads up right to the base of the Tepozteco. 

CLIMBING TEPOZTECO:
Leading up to Tepozteco there are dozens of food stands and other carts selling trinkets. Once you pass these many tents, you get to the base of the climb. The climb is very steep and often slippery. Wear comfortable shoes such as sneakers or hiking boots. The climb is up some carved stairs and mostly rocks. The climb up takes about an hour to an hour and a half. The end of the climb is some ancient ruins which you can also climb up and take in the views of the surrounding mountains and town. The climb down is tough on your knees and ankles - be careful and make sure you have steady footing as you make your way down. 

Make sure to bring enough water to drink. There are no bathrooms anywhere on the trail so make sure to use one of the restrooms in town before you climb. There are many stores offering use of their bathroom for ~5 pesos. 

IN THE TOWN:
In Tepotzlan, there are many little restaurants and stores. We ate lunch at El Chinelo, on 5th Ave. They serve hearty Mexican fare; we had chicken mole and breaded steak. There is also a very popular ice cream place, called Teponieves, which serves hundreds of flavors of ice creams. The flavors are mostly fruity and some are quite exotic. You order your vessel first (cone, cup, etc.) then you go to the flavors counter and get your flavors. 

LEAVING TEPOZTECO:
This was the most stressful part of our trip. You get a cab from Tezpotlan to the bus station, which should take 5-10 minutes and cost 30 pesos. At the bus station, buy your tickets for back to Mexico City. The buses do not always run on time; our bus was quite late and there was lots of traffic getting back into the city as well, so we did not get back until late. Keep this in mind as you are deciding when you want to get back to Mexico City.

401822561.name: beautiful view; arrive early to avoid crowds
401822561.author: a TripAdvisor user
401822561.reviewBody:
We arrived at the city around 9am. There are few small parking lots at the street that leads to the pyramid (run by locals, marked with ´E´ like estacion). The one we stopped at was 10 min walk from beginning of the entrance of the Park, costed us 50 pesos for unlimited time. There is also one super close to the entrance, it was 35 pesos for regular size cars. On that parking lot there is a clean bathroom for 5 pesos. Toilet at the entrance of the park is awful so better stop by that parking lot if you are in need.

Hiking up the mountain is quite tiring, but 100% worth it!!! It took me and my boyfriend 50 min to get to the pyramid, with few breaks for taking some pictures. At the top you can buy some water. The enter ticket to the pyramid is 50 pesos, unless you are a student, then it´s free. 

Better don´t take out your food while you´re on the top, coatis appear near you immidietly. I was a witness when one of coatis climbed up a guy who took out food from his pocket! Nevertheless they look absolutely cute. 

The view at the valley is stunnnig. You can see beautiful plant around as well. 
And the fresh, cool air- perfect after spending long time in Mexico City. 

I´d definitely go there again!

398199626.name: What a great day with exercise
398199626.author: a TripAdvisor user
398199626.reviewBody: Tepozteco is a great place to exercise with beautiful scenery. Also kid friendly. If one was to visit they would never regret it.

387608670.name: tiring but satisfying
387608670.author: a TripAdvisor user
387608670.reviewBody: this climb is steep and not o the faint of heart. access is from the center of town and best done on weekdays are weekends the mountain can be crowded

384717856.name: A must do in Tepoztlan
384717856.author: a TripAdvisor user
384717856.reviewBody: If you are up to experience what Tepoztlan is all about you need to climb the Tepozteco. Although not a long hike, it is steep and there are lots of rocks. So make sure to wear comfortable shoes and watch your step. Make sure to go early, especially on the weekends as it can get very crowded and miss on the magical experience. Summer is the rainy season so you can expect to see the lushness of the mountains at this time of the year. After the climb... make sure to stop by the market and get a jugo of a fruit of your choice and a quesadilla.

383831940.name: Tepozteco
383831940.author: a TripAdvisor user
383831940.reviewBody: Great place to hike and watch a great view on top of the mountains. Just be prepared for an hour or two of rock stair climbing.

380062459.name: Excellent hiking
380062459.author: a TripAdvisor user
380062459.reviewBody: You should go wearing sneakers at least. If you workout it could take 40 minutes get to the top. You can go with your pet , but he/she can\'t go to the top, they are permit until the metallic stairs . You must to pay 50 pesos per person to get up. \n\nIn the top they sell water 15 pesos per bottle.

379704841.name: More difficult than expected
379704841.author: a TripAdvisor user
379704841.reviewBody: Be prepared for a good 45 min to an hour of stair climbing - great workout! There is tree coverage for most of the way so at least the sun isn\'t beating down on you. You\'ll definitely need water - there are vendors at the bottom steps. Make sure you don\'t bring food up to the top though because there are coatimundi who are quite aggressive and I saw them attack a couple people\'s bags. Dogs are not allowed at the top. The indigenous temple at the top is simple compared to many others in Mexico, but still worth the hike. Many people were holding spiritual ceremonies near or on the temple. Entrance is free on Sundays.

377981257.name: Go early
377981257.author: a TripAdvisor user
377981257.reviewBody:
Awesome experience but you need to get Early around 8:00 am. The trail is 1.5 km and you climb around 300 meters. Some parts are stiff and there are lots of people that have no idea of what they are facing. Avoid the crowds and you will be fine. 

No pets allowed in the Archeological spot. 
It is a magic place

363561153.name: Caminada asia Tepoztlan
363561153.author: a TripAdvisor user
363561153.reviewBody: Nice place to spend a few days at. The walk to el Tepozteco is a bit tough specially if your not in shape. Took us about 1hr to get up the hill but once your up there you can apreciate the views. Make sure you take some water with you, there is a place on top where they sometimes sell water and snacks but it\'s not always open. Also there are alot of "tejones" or raccoon looking type of animals. Don\'t feed them cause you are not allowed to feed them. You also have to pay a small fee once you made it all the way to the top...

362407771.name: Nice visit
362407771.author: a TripAdvisor user
362407771.reviewBody: A real nice place with a wonderfull view! Make sure to take your sunscreen, a lot of water and take pauses when you feel tired! Its worth it. Also, don\'t forget your Hiking shoes, cause if you go with running ones, you could twist your ankle.

362153179.name: Worth the effort.
362153179.author: a TripAdvisor user
362153179.reviewBody: It\'s a very hard hike up and even harder coming down, but well worth it for the ruins and amazing views. Mind your posessions as the possums are a menace.

352591794.name: Great early morning hike with good views
352591794.author: a TripAdvisor user
352591794.reviewBody: This is a great hike and the views are well worth it at the top.  However, I would recommend going early in the morning as it gets really hot when the sun comes around and shines into the valley you are climbing up.  Leave around 8 and get to the top when Tepozteco opens.  Also, go on a weekday, as it is rarely crowded early on a weekday morning.  It is a strenuous climb due to the high altitude (starting at 7000 feet), but it is quite safe as they\'ve built stairs for most of the way.  This is not a nature hike.  The temple at the top is small, so this is not really about visiting an archeological site.  There is some information about the temple and the pyramid itself, but that\'s it.

350885809.name: Quite a hike but the view is incredible!
350885809.author: a TripAdvisor user
350885809.reviewBody: It\'s a pretty long hike to get to the top but the view from the pyramid is absolutely amazing.  A must do when in Tepoztlan!

349963330.name: Magic place...
349963330.author: a TripAdvisor user
349963330.reviewBody:
This is one of my favorites gateways ever. It's like an old town in the middle of the mountains but with a warm and nice weather. 
There tons of things to do, like climb the Tepozteco and visit the pyramid at the top of the mountain. Eat in the local restaurants (Mexican food), visit the cathedral at the center of the town, and of course, have a good cold beer at the local bars. 
This place is also famous for the relaxing spas all over the town, you can have a good massage and relaxing therapy. 
If you are traveling around Mexico city this is a must. Just 30 minutes away from the concrete city.

349835921.name: Not Worth It
349835921.author: a TripAdvisor user
349835921.reviewBody:
This is not a hike, it is a natural rock staircase the entire way up.  It is very steep and was exceedingly crowded with people the afternoon (a Sunday) that we did it.  I don't think it was worth the time it took. 

Yes, you get a good view of the valley around you, but really so what.....much better to visit Xochicalco and enjoy the views from up there.  

It took me 1 hour and 25 minutes to reach the top, and 40 minutes to go down the stairs.  I am used to clambering on rocks, so could basically run most of the way down, some people were having much more trouble going down than up.  The up part left me quite winded, I had just arrived in Mexico and hadn't adjusted to the altitude, although don't know how much difference that would have made.  

I would have preferred to spend more time in the town.  I did not feel any "special vibrations" in Tepoztlan and actually do feel these in some places.  Just not there

348985032.name: Climb for the Views
348985032.author: a TripAdvisor user
348985032.reviewBody:
This was our second climb and it was still hard but rewarding.  The climb starts out fairly easy with stone stairs but soon deteriorates into well placed rocks to navigate and the odd set of stairs.  Close to the top there are a set of switchback iron stairs that are quite steep but have handrails.  At the top you will have to pay $50 Pesos to access the pyramid.  Fit bit clocked the number of stair levels at just over 100.  Be prepared to be greeted by a herd of Coti as you approach the top, especially if you are carrying any food as their sense of smell is acute and they will be at your backpack or container in a flash and they are very adept at removing your goodies.
The pyramid itself is not overly interesting except for its historic value and where it was built.  When visiting Tepoztlan, the pyramid is one of the cities prime attractions.  Just do it.  Budget  1 to 2 hours up and 30 minutes down.  Wear solid footwear, carry water or purchase it at the top.  And early morning is better to beat the mid day heat.  The area open 9 to 5, and free on Sundays.

El Tepozteco is an archaeological site in the Mexican state of Morelos. It consists of a small temple to the Aztec god Tepoztecatl, a god of the alcoholic pulque beverage.

345480952.name: Tough hike, but worth it!
345480952.author: a TripAdvisor user
345480952.reviewBody: I was definitely humbled on out clime to Tepozteco today, much more difficult of a hike than I expected. However, even with numerous short breaks on the way up, we reached the top in 52 minutes. The hike is shaded most of the way as well, which kept it cooler. We began to climb around 10am, was relatively busy but not crazy. I hear afternoons are busier as are Sundays (admission is free on sundays). Admission was 50 pesos to view the pyramid at the top. Keep an eye on the coatis, they are very cute but one quickly tried to snipe items from my bag as I was getting my camera out! Worth the hike to see the beautiful view.

342662141.name: Great climb
342662141.author: a TripAdvisor user
342662141.reviewBody: Highly recommend, but go in the morning to beat the crowd.  Best to do with athletic shoes and running/hiking clothing.

342112983.name: 15 min
342112983.author: a TripAdvisor user
342112983.reviewBody: It took me 3 hours the first time to hike all the way up there, then I lost weight and it took me 1 hr. Then it takes me about 45 min. Wear proper shoes specially during the rainy season. I heard it took some Italian guy  7 minutes to get to the top. Amazing.

341806836.name: detox
341806836.author: a TripAdvisor user
341806836.reviewBody:
One of the best hikes I've ever done in Mexico, it is tough but very satisfactory when you get to the top and relax at he pyramid.

It is a must if not you didn't felt the real energy of this amazing town.

338987266.name: Yoga at the sky
338987266.author: a TripAdvisor user
338987266.reviewBody: Definitely awesome. It was a really long climb, but the sightseeing was amazing and at the top you can really connect with yourself and the nature

333067011.name: Peace and beauty all around!
333067011.author: a TripAdvisor user
333067011.reviewBody: The Tepozteco\'s 2.4 Km hike is worth every step to glimpse into the lives of our ancestors. The first time I hiked some one told me to go steady and not to stop and rest, just slow down if needed. As you slow down take a look around and listen to all the birds flying and signing about. Once you reach the temples approach them with all due respect and enjoy the peace and beauty around you.

331416958.name: great views, sightseeing, exercise, and food
331416958.author: a TripAdvisor user
331416958.reviewBody: close to Mexico city, it has a great view, beautiful town, great authentic food (eat at the plaza) it\'s worth it at least for a day.

328995744.name: For the nature , for the climbing  ,for the view , but not especially for the ruins
328995744.author: a TripAdvisor user
328995744.reviewBody: The trail up to Tepozteco is a 45 minutes ( aprox) climbing of 400 meters-up on a two kilometers distance, for some untrained or less fit people  it might be tough .Although we saw a few people jogging up at good speed .  Most of the walking is in a nice shadow from the many trees , but still it is better to start early as it becomes quite hot and quite crowded after 11am.\nThe people in charge ( INAH ) do their best to keep it nice and clean , but some of the visitors don\'t help , littering on their way ; so you might have a different perception if you go up before or after the dirty ones . Theoretically pets are not allowed as they might frighten  wild animals, birds and the coatis who live close to the pyramid at the top  , but still we saw quite a number of dogs on the trail.\nThe trail is free, but the access to the pyramid and to the best view costs 47 MXP ( free on sunday )

326094460.name: From above.
326094460.author: a TripAdvisor user
326094460.reviewBody: Climbing to the Tepozteco is a most do while in Tepoztlan. The climb is hard, but not as hard and the reward is priceless. The view from above is breathtaking and liberating.

326059953.name: A good Challenge
326059953.author: a TripAdvisor user
326059953.reviewBody: The view at the Top of the Tepozteco totally payoff for the around 1 hour effort walking up. The views of the city and the mountains around the pyramid are beautiful. It is a challenge but it is worthy and very healthy.

323992189.name: Great view from the top
323992189.author: a TripAdvisor user
323992189.reviewBody: If going up on a Sunday, start no later than 10:00am because when you go down it is very crowded. Amazing view from the summit!!

322319047.name: Good views but big climb
322319047.author: a TripAdvisor user
322319047.reviewBody: A much bigger climb than I had expected, but rewarded by some great views of the local country. The pyramid itself was a bit disappointing. The lime and soda stall at the top was much appreciated.

321495226.name: Steep climb but great view
321495226.author: a TripAdvisor user
321495226.reviewBody: Go early in the day so you can ascend in relatively cooler weather. There is an entrance fee when you get to the top, to get to the pyramid, but it\'s not very much money and you get a good view of Tepoztlan. Beware of the cheeky coatis; they are relatively harmless but very persistent in trying to get into your bags! They can scale up the sides of the pyramid and approach in total stealth, so don\'t be surprised! You have been warned.

320768947.name: If you are in Cuernavaca, don\'t miss Tepoz
320768947.author: a TripAdvisor user
320768947.reviewBody: I enjoyed the hike a lot even though it was hard at some points. We walked slowly with breaks up in a bit more than an hour and made it down again in about 30-40 minutes. Take your time up there to relax your knees as even my knees hurt on the descent and I usually don\'t have problems with my knees. Bring good shoes, a bottle of water and some snacks. The view is amazing up there!

320330541.name: You can do this!
320330541.author: a TripAdvisor user
320330541.reviewBody:
(resubmitting because Trip Advisor things I used profanity in my review - I think they didn't know what "yes you can" in Spanish means)

You can do this. It might take a while, and you'll likely be a sweaty mess and slightly wobbly in the legs by the time you get down, but you CAN do this, just plan to take a lot of breaks if you aren't in the best shape. It's not just the views at the top that are worth it, the entire hike is beautiful and awe inspiring. 

Just so you get a sense of who else is doing this, I saw: 
- Toddlers 
- Infants being carried (no contraptions, just carried) 
- Infants being carried while nursing 
- Grandparents 
- Nice sandals (I think the highest I saw was about a two inch wedge - I saw a review earlier saying high heels would probably be fine ... I admire her moxy, but please don't wear high heels) 
- Every kind of walking/hiking/running shoe 

There are no handrails. There are no fences to catch you. There are big rocks and trees to hold onto, and other people who will gladly lend you a hand if you need it. 

There are no bathrooms at the top of the hike, or anywhere along the walk, so get that taken care of before you head up. 

There is a small admission at the top for non-residents of Mexico. 

There are coati at the top, they're adorable and will hound you for food. Don't feed them, it's not good for them and there's a big sign at the top that says ... don't feed them. 

Go early, if you can - it gets crowded, which can add a little stress if you are afraid of heights/falling. 

One bottle of water should be fine. 

If you're zooming/teenaged/trying to prove something, you can make it up in about 30 minutes. If you're taking your time, closer to an hour and a half. 

At the bottom of the hike are several stalls to purchase food, drinks, and souvenirs. They'll be there on the way back, so don't add to your load by purchasing anything on the way up. But before you go, you might want to research the town itself, it's really cute and lots of shops and restaurants and might be worth spending a little time in. We didn't do that and I wish we had. 

If you are driving your own vehicle, keep in mind that this is a very, very old town. The roads are narrow, cobbled, and steep. You'll be able to find parking in several spots on the way up to the trailhead (remember, the sign for parking is a big "E"), we parked in someone's yard for thirty pesos, and they had a bathroom for five pesos as well. 

Have fun ...

319702489.name: Reached the top exhausted and exhilarated.
319702489.author: a TripAdvisor user
319702489.reviewBody: Thankfully, water was available when I reached the top.  It was a great hike worth repeating.  1 hour up, 45mins down\u2026should be relatively fit to enjoy.

319400825.name: Just Do It!
319400825.author: a TripAdvisor user
319400825.reviewBody: This is something you just have to do in Tepoztlan. The view, the pyramid, and the coatmundis (raccoon-like critters) make it totally worth the serious climb to the summit.

318425978.name: Only for the strong ones. You will find a vigilant pyramid after a superb hike.
318425978.author: a TripAdvisor user
318425978.reviewBody: The hike is the best part, even though it seems there is a regular road up hill it is not, you will have a challenging but easy climb, surrounded of an amazing vegetation, and the reward is the view of the valley at the top. This is a very popular climb on the weekends, so do it in the morning.\nThere is a modest bar at the top so you really need no equipment.

316592746.name: Great workout, but steeper than you may think
316592746.author: a TripAdvisor user
316592746.reviewBody: Great day trip from Mexico City--but this hike is steeper than you might expect, and the rocks get very slippery. You can do it in an hour, but it\'s uphill all the time. Resist the urge to buy souvenirs on the way up--buy them on the way down. Lots of food and drinks are available, so don\'t worry if you forgot your water. Go earlier in the day during the rainy season, and I wouldn\'t recommend going up after 2 p.m. or so during the rainy season, because you will get rained on and it won\'t be pleasant. Great view from the top, but if you are coming from the U.S., keep in mind that it\'s high altitude. Afterwards, head to a lovely lunch/dinner at Los Colorines.

306655255.name: Good view from the top
306655255.author: a TripAdvisor user
306655255.reviewBody: Worth the climb up the top.  Took us approx 1.5 hours, ensure you have good walking shoes and water.  The entrance is 47 pesos per person.

305535292.name: Good exercise
305535292.author: a TripAdvisor user
305535292.reviewBody: A fun 45-60 minutes walk up\nGood view of the valley, the Temple is not much \nbest to do this early in the morning

305524851.name: Hard hike but worth it
305524851.author: a TripAdvisor user
305524851.reviewBody: Went with my family (kids ages 2 and 6).  We made it up in 1 hr 15 mins.  Definitely a hard hike with kids but worth the views.  Get there early before it gets too crowded and hot.

302701832.name: Magic Town
302701832.author: a TripAdvisor user
302701832.reviewBody: The very typical town of Tepoztlan, with its open market and arts and crafts shops, is a real picture of Mexico and its people. 60 minutes from Mexico City, 45 minutes from Cuautla, 30 minutes from Cuernavaca, 2 hours from Puebla and 3 hours 30 min from Acapulco. The area offers 3 golf courses less than 45 minutes away, tours to colonial convents, churches and haciendas, archeological sites and markets, as well as walks, hiking and climbing to the Ancient Piramid located on the very top of The Tepozteco Mountain. The streets are very unique! Be careful thought, the streets are very steep. I loved it!!

302684073.name: Totally worth it
302684073.author: a TripAdvisor user
302684073.reviewBody: The climb is a challenge, but is totally worth it. We climbed with my parents (+58 both) and it took us around two hours to reach the top, but it was worth it. Take your time, bring enough water and enjoy the views!

300948463.name: Perfect views of Tepoztlan
300948463.author: a TripAdvisor user
300948463.reviewBody: This is a great hike with a lot of elevation gain, probably requiring at least half a day. The view of Tepoztlan from the top is exquisite. I was a little disappointed that in order to move anywhere beyond the small tourist area at the top, it required an admission fee. But it was worth checking out the ancient pyramid.

300699350.name: Over a difficult hike totally worth
300699350.author: a TripAdvisor user
300699350.reviewBody: I love hiking on the trail it was really hard but well worth the wait because the ruins at the top of the mountain are spectacular and you get a wonderful view of the city below

295376238.name: Intense hike but worth it!
295376238.author: a TripAdvisor user
295376238.reviewBody: Went on a Sunday, which is the day they don\'t charge for admission (which is also the day when everyone and their mom goes as well).  The other days they do charge so make sure to bring money because the climb is brutal and you don\'t want to get there,after the strenuous climb and not be able to get in...try to go in the morning, less people, and not as hot.  As other people have mentioned, it is a steep vertical hike, on slippery rocks.  Wear tennis shoes, bring water and take your time. Water and food is sold at the bottom (is pricer than that sold in town), and snacks and drinks sold at a shack as you arrive to the top.  I was hiking with 9 kids and 8 adults and we make it up in 1.5 hours, and down in 1 hour.  The pyramid itself is not as awe-inspiring as Teotihucan but still very cool.  The view over Tepoztlan and the area around is amazing. Also, you see Coatis everywhere!  Really cool looking animals that look like a cross between a red panda and an ant-eater.

295233856.name: First Hike
295233856.author: a TripAdvisor user
295233856.reviewBody: This was my first hike and I was rewarded by amazing scenery once I reached the top. There were also awesome views on the way up. People were really friendly and encouraging to one another along the way. I was tickled at how the children moved along as if hiking a mountain is a teeny fete. Watch out for the little critters at the top. They will snatch your drink or food before you know it, but otherwise seem harmless.

293885356.name: A great hike and a great view.
293885356.author: a TripAdvisor user
293885356.reviewBody: Had a great climb and an even better meal in the market below.  The pyramid itself is not that spectacular, but the view is great.

286186902.name: Strenuous hike, rewarded with great views along the way and at the end
286186902.author: a TripAdvisor user
286186902.reviewBody: This Aztec pyramid is about 1 hour by bus from Mexico City.  The hike begins at the edge of town at the gate to the archaeological preserve.  From the start of the hike to the top you climb from 400 meters to 2,150 meters in just 2km.  Since you are basically climbing steps/boulders the entire time, you MUST be in good shape.  About half our fellow hikers turned around well before making it to the top.  But once you are there the views are spectacular.  After paying the $47 pesos fee, you can climb the small pyramid and get even better views.  Given the fair number of people we hiked with on a Monday, we can only presume the trail would be mobbed and quite frustrating on the weekend.

280231772.name: Worth the effort and exertion
280231772.author: a TripAdvisor user
280231772.reviewBody: The 1200\' climb from the base to the Tepozteco pyramid feels like 1200 meters. It\'s a fairly steep climb and the rocks are quite slick when wet (which they often are).  Wear proper climbing footwear, we saw numerous folks perilously slip sliding. \nWe did the climb in a leisurely 90 minutes and the view from the top is worth the effort. The signs at the top said a fee of $47 pesos per person, but on the day if our ascent nobody was there to collect it. \nBe sure to bring water for the climb, although there is water sold at the bottom and the top.

279720545.name: 4 stars because i didnt get to see it..booo
279720545.author: a TripAdvisor user
279720545.reviewBody:
It closes at 5, which the locals warned me about. 
What they didn’t warn me about was that once it closes, even if you reach the top, which I did, you will not be able to see the pyramid at all. Not a glance. There is a large spiked fence that guards some stairs that im guessing lead you to the top where you can see and climb the pyramid. So yea it was not a total waste since the scenery on the way up was nice and that was the most cardio I have ever done, ever.  At least coming down felt like a breeze. 

(...and just to defend my stupid idea to climb to the top knowing it would be closed by the time i reached the top, i was hoping to be able to at least get a picture of the pyramid, or at least a nice view, but no, from where the trail ends you cannot see the town just more wilderness and hill tops. FYI in case this happens to you, just come back; one local warned me that after it gets dark out it was not so safe to be up there. It was our only day there, and i really wanted to see it, so took the chance. )

279387452.name: Is that all there is?
279387452.author: a TripAdvisor user
279387452.reviewBody: Skip Tepozteco, head for the hills towering over the ruins. Get the real views of Tepoztlan and surrounding area.

278398980.name: Wonderful!! Peaceful!!
278398980.author: a TripAdvisor user
278398980.reviewBody: great place to go with family or friends. this is truly one of my favorite places to go. every time i go visit Mexico i have to make a stop in tepoztlan!! its just so beautiful full with colors, culture, and just peacefulness !!

278173640.name: Wouldn\'t do it twice but once is fine
278173640.author: a TripAdvisor user
278173640.reviewBody: This is one of the less exciting and interesting temples you\'ll see in your life and, on its own, not really worth the slog up the hill. But the hike itself is nice, winding through a very steep ravine for a couple miles before popping out at the top. The views are awesome, though, and the experience is what you\'re after anyway. Just be sure you\'re fit enough to tackle this hike: it is at a higher elevation than many are accustomed to (around 6,000 feet at the base), and it is steep. Go early and take advantage of the various street food stalls on the way back to town.

276304954.name: Great hike with stunning views at the top
276304954.author: a TripAdvisor user
276304954.reviewBody: I did this hike with family on a recent day trip to Tepoztl\u00e1n. It took us an hour to reach the pyramid (from the start of the trail), then we spent about 30 to 45 mins taking in the views and relaxing. The pyramid is quite small but stunning nonetheless. Then it took us another 45 mins to get back down. The hike is quite steep in parts but I think most people can do it if you do it at your own pace. There are some parts which are only rock (other are rock stairs) but it is never dangerous. We started the hike at midday which was fine because it was a cloudy day, I think it would have been much more difficult it was hotter. If you are going to Tepoztl\u00e1n then this is a must do!

266264196.name: Rewarded with amazing views of Tepoztl\u00e1n
266264196.author: a TripAdvisor user
266264196.reviewBody:
I visited Tepoztlán & the pyramid Tepozteco on a day trip from Mexico with two friends in early March. If you are getting a taxi to the bus station from your Mexico City hotel make sure you are very clear about which bus station you need to go to. Our concierge arranged our taxi & they took us to the north bus station as there is another town with a similar name that departs from there! The Tepoztlán buses all depart from the south bus station & it took us an hour to get back to the right station, not a good start.
The bus journey takes under 1.5 hours & the buses have large reclining seats so very comfortable. You are dropped at the station on the outskirts of town & from here we caught a taxi to the start of the walk up to the pyramid which was our main reason for visiting.
I really enjoyed the walk up, its tough going but you see all ages & even though we started in the midday heat there was shade from tree coverage all the way up.
 Good footwear is essentIal as the path is a mixture of steps & rocks. 
You pay a small entrance fee at the top to visit the pyramid which then gives you fantastic views of the town below. 
You can buy water & snacks at the start of the trail & also again at the top. There were also toilets at the top.
The town itself had plenty of restaurants to refuel before your journey home & would also make a good base for visiting the surrounding areas.
 Tepoztlán  is a great destination if you want to get away from the hustle & bustle of Mexico City without traveling too far & the town has a far more traditional Mexican vibe than being in the City. 
I would definitely return.

261725501.name: Steep climb all the way to the top with great view.
261725501.author: a TripAdvisor user
261725501.reviewBody:
As all the other reviews say, it's very challenging steep climb for about 45min to 1 1/2 hour depends on your fitness level. 
It's more like a natural stair master than hiking.   

You should bring a bottle of water and start hiking early at 9am when they open.  There is $43 fee to see temple.  the temple opens at 11. 

Some rocks are VERY slippery and I almost slipped twice with my sneakers on.  I wouldn't wear flip flops or heels like some people do.   Stay away weekends as it gets very crowded.

And YES, the view is priceless and worth every step.

261556274.name: Hike like a Local
261556274.author: a TripAdvisor user
261556274.reviewBody: It\'s a good idea to start early to beat the heat.  We didn\'t realize that the pyramid opened at 9 so we ended up waiting at the top, but we ran into quite a few locals out for their morning exercise. Everyone was happy to greet us and one man walked the second half with us. He was glad to show us the way and talk with us.  We did some exploring on the trail at the top which led to some great views.  The views from the pyramid are great, but the real experience is the hike to the top. Try to do this on a weekday when Tepoztlan is quiet and there are not many tourists.

260928558.name: Worth the steep hike
260928558.author: a TripAdvisor user
260928558.reviewBody: We climbed up to Tepozteco this morning and are currently sitting having a few drinks. Beverages are very necessary after returning from the site. It\'s up to an hour hike pretty much straight uphill depending on how many stops you take. Well worth the hike though as the views are spectacular back down towards the town and Cuernavaca in the distance. The walk up is aweful but the smug feeling when walking down and watching everyone else struggle their way up makes it marginally worth while. Wear good shoes, layer clothing because you WILL get sweaty, go early (9am) and take water.\nThe pir\u00e0mide is OK. Other tourists sit all over it so don\'t expect to get great photos without heaps of people in them. The Coaties are funny little animals semi tamed and will try steal your food but are funny to watch, especially when stealing food from others.

253872927.name: Great workout! Incredible views!
253872927.author: a TripAdvisor user
253872927.reviewBody: Tepozteco is always the highlight of my trip to Tepoztlan! It is quite a hike to the top but somehow I always come back down feeling energized. Tepoztlan is truly a magical pueblo!

253171658.name: worth every single step!
253171658.author: a TripAdvisor user
253171658.reviewBody: hello i visited tepoztlan a long time ago and i just wanted to share my experience with you.\nhiking u the mountain is a real challenge,but is worth every single step. we took lots of breaks along the way and made it to the top of the pyramid. the view from up there is incredible. if you ever visit tepoztlan do not miss on hiking up the pyramid. lots of racoons everywhere.

250679352.name: Beautiful, historical and breathtaking
250679352.author: a TripAdvisor user
250679352.reviewBody:
I was at the tepozteco on Monday and my was it nice. Several things to consider first it's free! Yes free no charge however if want to see the ruins (pyramid, tower etc) its 47 pesos which is less than $5 us dollars depending on the exchange rate. On Sundays the attraction is free but pretty crowded. 
I recommend comfortable shoes however if your caught wearing flip flops or high heels it's not the end of the world. 
Also there no bathrooms around so make sure to go in town. Bathrooms are limited in tepoztlan overall so be ready to pay 5 pesos everytime you go. 
Enjoy some exotic fruits, waters and a must have a tepoz ice cream they're awesome.

249883091.name: Astonishing view
249883091.author: a TripAdvisor user
249883091.reviewBody: Tough climb! Still worth it. The view is marvelous\nThe pyramid is not too large and you need some dexterity in hiking\nThe town and valley view is worth the effort

249842634.name: Worth the effort!
249842634.author: a TripAdvisor user
249842634.reviewBody: Up, up, up. Wow! The view from the top is incredible. But be sure you have good walking shoes. It\'s steep and long!

246262743.name: Stunning views
246262743.author: a TripAdvisor user
246262743.reviewBody: This is the pyramid atop the Sierra de Tepoztl\u00e1n in Tepoztl\u00e1n, Morelos. The start of the hike is only about 6 blocks north of the zocalo. Pro tip - be prepared! Dress as if you are taking a real hike, because you will be. Wear good shoes like hiking boots or sneakers. Bring plenty of water. Wear clothing you can wear in the bush. The hike up climbs 1312 vertical ft. It\'s more than 3000 steps and takes 1-2 hours to complete. Once at the top the pyramid itself is modest and small. The artificial terraces are small. But the views are staggering. Just beautiful. Then be prepared for another 1 hour to get down. The trip in total will probably take you 2.5 - 4 hours depending on your stamina. It is quite an experience.

245929125.name: Incredible view!
245929125.author: a TripAdvisor user
245929125.reviewBody:
You can arrive early, around 8am, if you want to climb and descend fast  (for example as training), but you cannot get access to the top of the pyramid until 11am, at that time the doors open to all visitors and you can appreciate an incredible view. Also you can enjoy different and amazing views during the  climbing that worth the effort.

The pyramid has a lot of visitors every day (of all ages); much of these are groups like scouts, yoguis, runners.

It is a "must" if you're around!!

243403574.name: Worth the hike
243403574.author: a TripAdvisor user
243403574.reviewBody: It was a very worthwhile hike up to the pyramid but we were disappointed that they didn\'t make it very clear how far it was. The views from the top were amazing and the historical site was very interesting.

242360912.name: TAKE YOU TENNIS SHOES
242360912.author: a TripAdvisor user
242360912.reviewBody: I went all dressed up and did the walk but i ended up with blisters all over my feet ! it was an amazing outorsy experience but next time I will defenetely take my tennis !
