242351759.name: Come Visit Our Local Deity
242351759.author: a TripAdvisor user
242351759.reviewBody:
How many places have their own local god? How many places have a center of the essential energy of the town. Tepozteco is the name of the deity in whose honor this pyramid was built, Tepoztlan is his Land, this is his village. The local residents still venerate this deity with several festivals each year...one where the town meets at midnight at the pyramid.

It is a good uphill walk for 45 minutes, if you are in decent shape. Some nuts run the trail daily.  If ou are not in a competitive mood, take your time, rest frequently-- good excuse to enjoy the small, lush valley you are walking in.

Sundays are free( lots of people), Mondays closed, 30 pesos/person otherwise. Once you get down, try the Axitla restaurant at the beginning of the trail to refresh yourself and enjoy!

239331338.name: Great view
239331338.author: a TripAdvisor user
239331338.reviewBody: The way up to the pyramid is great but if you aren\'t to sporty it is going to be heavy. There wasn\u00b4t to much to see at the pyramid but the view is great!

238076500.name: Great hike with a reward of amazing views.
238076500.author: a TripAdvisor user
238076500.reviewBody: It\'s a tough hike, not very long but you go up all the time. But believe me, it\'s well worth if you take your time and enjoy it - the views from the top are great!  The pyramid is OK - not the best you will find in Mexico- but if you add the location then it turns into something very special.

235765502.name: Worth the hike!
235765502.author: a TripAdvisor user
235765502.reviewBody: Better to climb first thing in the morning, less crowds and the light is wonderful.  The gates at the top open at 10AM.

235353842.name: Quaint town
235353842.author: a TripAdvisor user
235353842.reviewBody: Great history and food.  Lots of shopping, pottery, clothes, etc. The people were friendly and helpful.  I don\'t speak Spanish so shopping was a challenge.

233349174.name: Great climb with a nice ruin at the top ... animals are crazy!
233349174.author: a TripAdvisor user
233349174.reviewBody: I have been to these ruins several times while in Mexico City ... it is not too far from Mexico City and the nice little cheap hotels are nice in the town. Tepoztl\u00e1n can be reached by bus from the Central de Camiones del Sur (the southern bus station outside of the Tasque\u00f1a Metro stop) in about an hour or so if the traffic into our out Mexico City is not too bad.\n\nThe hike is nice and the view from the ruins fantastic. However the animals/rodents called tlacuaches in Spanish are quite aggressive when trying to get food ... so I would avoid bringing any up. They should really control this rodent problem in the future it is out of hand.

232663282.name: Excellent
232663282.author: a TripAdvisor user
232663282.reviewBody: I enjoyed the hike to Tepozteco so much. The surrounding nature is amazing and so is the view on top. The hike is about 1 - 1.5 hours, but we had good weather which made it quite easy. Strongly recommended.

223507126.name: Worth the hike
223507126.author: a TripAdvisor user
223507126.reviewBody: Great view, small pyramid. Worth the effort.  About an hour plus to climb up.  Bring water! Pay to use a restroom before you start the hike.

219275444.name: Worth the hike!
219275444.author: a TripAdvisor user
219275444.reviewBody:
I've spent 5 weeks in Mexico and have climbed many pyramids and ruins. This was one of my favorites. 

PROs:
- adventurous, albeit strenuous, hike
- clear-cut path, stone steps and step-like stones of various shapes and sizes
- Not as crowded as Coba in Tulum, Teotehuacan near Mexico City, or Machu Picchu in Peru.
- Most people hike around the same pace, but will move aside for those who are faster
- entire hike is shaded by trees, which you will appreciate greatly as you huff and puff up the mountain
- a cool, fresh air can be felt from a nearby stream
- do-able hike - I'm not a fan of hiking, but made it up in an hour and a half at a slow, steady pace with 3 or 4 few-minute breaks. I saw people of all ages (and footwear) climbing. Tennis shoes would be wise.
- I believe I saw bathrooms at the top
- obviously, the view from the top is the highlight
- tropical raccoon families will greet you along the last leg of the trail and are everywhere at the top. They are quite bold and while they did not bite, they growled angrily if not given more food. Please don't feed them. 
- you can sit along the edge of the pyramid and enjoy the view / take pictures (there is a fee of 43 pesos / $3.50 US )
- spend time in town after the hike. The convent is worth a quick look, and the market has really good, interesting food. 
- only 25 or so minutes outside of Cuernavaca
-Many buses go there and there's a bus stop there with buses to bring you back to town. The price is like...17 pesos ($1.50) each way.

CONS:
 - the climb is strenuous for un-seasoned hikers. Just climb slowly and take breaks. 
- you will sweat a lot (from the hike and the warmth). Obviously, an earlier start is preferable. I hiked mid-day from 12 to 3 and it was only the first half of the hike that I was drenched. Deodorant - don't leave home without it.
- there's no site for swimming
- bathrooms are not free (5 pesos = 4 cents)
-the path down is the same as the path up, but most people were patient and polite and waited to the side for others to pass. Most people. 
- it's basically a mountain hike. The "pyramid" viewable at the top is minimal.

In sum, I think it's a great place to spend the day and see some unique things. 

Happy travels!

216202337.name: Hike?
216202337.author: a TripAdvisor user
216202337.reviewBody:
We went to Tepoztlan to climb the mountain and see El Tepozteco.

1-The archeological site “El Tepozteco” is situated in the foothills of the city of Tepoztlan, Morelos; the temple was built in honor of the Aztec god TepoztecatI; god of the alcoholic beverage – pulque. The temple which resembles the top part of a pyramid is built on top of one of the peaks of the Sierra de Tepoztlan, overlooking the valley of Tepoztlan.
The pyramid is at approximately 2150 meters (7054 ft.) above sea level and at an altitude 400 meters (1,300 ft.) higher than the city of Tepoztlan; It takes approximately an hour to reach the top of the pyramid on foot; the path that leads the top of the pyramid is paved with river and quarry stones. (HubPages.com)
You need to be a cross between a mountain goat and Alain Robert to truly enjoy sweating up the steep flagstone steps to the top of the mountain in Tepotzlan, Morelos, Mexico, where is located the House of the God, Tepozteco. If you don't know who Robert is, look on Google like I did. (Diogenes Hubpages.com)

2-Actually, you truly have to be fit or insane to climb there. (Fit = 1 hour, Insane = 2 ½ hours). Coming back down took us 1 ½ hour (insane).
Is it worth it? I once read that the highest the mountain, the greatest the achievement in climbing it. This applies here as well. And, I must admit, the view is great.

3-Tepozteco consists of a small temple to the Aztec god Tepoztecatl, a god of the alcoholic pulque beverage.
The temple itself stands at the western side of the site. It consists of a 6.4-meter-high platform supporting a 3.3-meter-high temple base. Upon this stand the remains of the temple building, the remains of which now stand 2.7 meters high.[1] The temple was formed of two rooms. The first room opened onto the temple stairs, with two pillars flanking the entrance. In the centre of this room a small hollow was found, containing traces of charcoal and copal.
The entry to the small inner sanctum was also flanked by two pillars. The sculpture of Tepoztecatl was probably kept in this room. (Wikipedia)

4-There is only the temple but there are glyphs that make this site important. It was built between 1150 and  1350 before Christ. It is 600 meters up from the pueblo.
Note: There were several persons that I didnt think could possibly make it. Three of them, Mexicanos, started after us and completed before us.

213479999.name: Amazing Hike!
213479999.author: a TripAdvisor user
213479999.reviewBody: The hike to the top of Tepozteco was somewhat challenging but well worth it! We started our climb fairly early- by 7am we were on our way up the mountain- and we were rewarded by reasonable empty trails and a pretty clear view from the top. The pyramid itself is quite small but the experience of the climb made it one our favourite mornings in this part of Mexico.

213029915.name: Beautiful hotel to spend a restfull weekend
213029915.author: a TripAdvisor user
213029915.reviewBody: This hotel is located in a lovely city called Tepoztlan. The view of this hotel is amazing! I recommend to stay on it for at least one weekend

209746253.name: A quaint town with rich history
209746253.author: a TripAdvisor user
209746253.reviewBody: Tepozteco is a very small town that has many progressive qualities.  There are the usual town square with vendors and open market especially good on a saturday afternoon.  There are visible pyramids atop the huge mountain which is climbable for those that have stamina.. not for the faint of heart.   The town square features a stunning 15th century cathedral and courtyard.  The entrance is decorated by a mosaic of seeds and is replaced seasonally by the townspeople.  This is a quiet, friendly \'Magical\' city.  Extremely safe.

206235679.name: Great, exhausting outing with the family
206235679.author: a TripAdvisor user
206235679.reviewBody: My husband is from Mexico City, and we made an outing with the whole extended family to Tepozteco Pyramid in December, 2013. I think it\'s called the "Santuario" locally. The town of Tepoztlan is artsy and very quaint. We arrived in mid-afternoon on a Saturday, and it was very crowded.  We had a fabulous lunch outside with a great view of the surrounding mountains before heading up to the Pyramid.  It was a very long, strenuous hike.  Our group arrived at the top in stages.  My nieces, ages 9 and 14 did fine.  Watch your step--the terrain is very uneven, and some rocks aren\'t too stable.  It was a beautiful climb through the shaded woods, however.  If we\'d had more time, we could have taken it more slowly, but we had to hurry to the top before they closed.  Check the closing time on the day you go--we arrived just in time, but some people behind us were turned away at the top (quite a shame!)  The pyramid is not the most impressive, but there are some neat relief carvings inside it.  We had a blast.  Afterward, treat yourself to ice cream at the famous "Tepoznieves".  They have over 100 flavors, including rose petal!

205741873.name: Amazing scenary
205741873.author: a TripAdvisor user
205741873.reviewBody: If you make it to the top it\'s definitely worth it.  I\'ve hiked before, but I\'ve never climbed at that altitude.  It makes it a lot more difficult with less oxygen.  I underestimated the difficulty of the hike, although I don\'t think it was that difficult.  Wear proper shoes (although I hiked it in my Chacos) and bring water, because it is extremely hot.  When you get to the top, the \'pyramid\' is somewhat disappointing, although the views make up for it.  To get the pyramid is 43 pesos or free with a student ID.  They will not ask you for a student ID so make sure you show it to them so you don\'t have to pay.  There are also animals at the top, members of the badger family, called coati, also known as a tej\u00f3n.  Do not set your bag down or they will try to enter it.  Also do not bring food out or they will surround you.  This should go without saying, but do not try to pet them.  Although they are kind of cute, they are wild animals.  At a fast pace, with a fee stops, it takes roughly 45 minutes to 1 hour.  Use the bathroom before you head up the mountain, as there are known at the top.  However, you can purchase bottled water at the top for 15 pesos before you head bak down.

203744781.name: You\'re Going to Sweat.
203744781.author: a TripAdvisor user
203744781.reviewBody: The hike up to the Tepozteco pyramid only takes about an hour, but it is steep and requires a good level of fitness. No matter how fit you are, you\'re going to sweat. Bring at least a liter of water, wear sunscreen (I got so sunburned), and don\'t try to race with other people. The view from the top is worth it. The pyramid is small but lovely, and from there you can see both Tepoztlan and Cuernavaca. You can also interact with coati (small cat/raccoon-like animals) at the top. Overall, hiking el Tepozteco is a great way to spend a half day in Tepoztlan if you\'re looking for fun, exercise, and nature.

202442331.name: Great view, nice hike
202442331.author: a TripAdvisor user
202442331.reviewBody: Start out early to beat the heat and devote half a day to hike there and back-- and after patting yourself in the back for your accomplishment --enjoy a nice lunch!  Did see an 85 year old woman make it to the top but take it easy going back down.  They do sell drinks on top but take some for the way up.

201077436.name: Spectacular view!
201077436.author: a TripAdvisor user
201077436.reviewBody: When you reach the top, the last part of the hike is a very steep staircase that can get a bit crowded. Access to the archaeological site after that is 43 pesos per person and it is free for children under 13 years old, students, teachers and seniors with valid ID. At the top of the mountain you will find the remains of a temple which was made of two rooms. You can climb up the few steps to see the pyramid remains. The view from the top is spectacular.\n\nCheck out the entire article in my blog about Tepoztlan! http://lagamio.com/2014/04/14/tepoztlan/

201077165.name: The view from the top is spectacular
201077165.author: a TripAdvisor user
201077165.reviewBody: It can take between 25 to 60 minutes to get to the top of the mountain, depending on your condition. Even though it has steps built out of stone, it is not an easy hike. You should bring plenty of water and comfortable shoes to climb and take breaks along the way as you feel that you need them. I took my time to do so. When you reach the top, the last part of the hike is a very steep staircase that can get a bit crowded. Access to the archaeological site after that is 43 pesos per person and it is free for children under 13 years old, students, teachers and seniors with valid ID. At the top of the mountain you will find the remains of a temple which was made of two rooms. You can climb up the few steps to see the pyramid remains.\n\nCheck out my article about the town of Tepoztlan in http://lagamio.com/2014/04/14/tepoztlan/

199672905.name: Climbed the mountain to the pyramid!
199672905.author: a TripAdvisor user
199672905.reviewBody: This was very difficult but I am glad that I did it! The view from the top was magnificent! Make sure you wear tennis shoes if you are going to tackle this!

198780218.name: Set off early!  Beautiful view!
198780218.author: a TripAdvisor user
198780218.reviewBody:
The hike to get to the top is moderate.  Make sure you pack some water.  On the weekend it gets very busy so set off early!

The cost to get to the pyramid at the top is around 50 pesos.  There are also concessions available so bring your student card if you have one.

When you get to the top, be warned there are some friendly critters (see picture) who will steal any of your food or drink if you are not careful.  They are not aggressive, but very confident!  And also extremely cute!

195798544.name: A Day at La Villa Bonita Tepotzlan
195798544.author: a TripAdvisor user
195798544.reviewBody:
My husband and I recently spent the day learning how to cook like a "real Mexican" at La Villa Bonita and not only had the opportunity to visit the lush grounds, meet great people and most importantly, listening to Chef Ana teach us the techniques associated with cooking great food and simple recipes, we were able to enjoy every bit of what we prepared that day.   We were asked if we had anything in mind we were interested in making and  I made a request for Pozole.

We were staying at a hotel in Cuerva Vaca (about an hour away) and purchased an a la carte service of a half day cooking service.   We were graciously picked up at our hotel since it was on the way to the market to purchase the foods we would be using that day.  The commercial market was a fascinating experience followed by a authentic breakfast at a beautiful restaurant with interior waterfalls and garden.    Once back at LVB, we went to work and made ceviche, salsa, mole, arroz, pozole, roasted zucchini with melted cheese and flan for dessert.
It was a mesmerizing experience because Ana works with no recipes and instructs us in a very non-intimating instructional style.   Everyone was helping in the open air kitchen, eating, laughing, drinking and enjoying each others company while we were at work cooking.  I was a little nervous about not remembering all the techniques but she shared all the recipes with group so we can make at home.  Since returning, I've made many of the same recipes (with the exception of her mole, which I don't think can ever be replicated since it was the most unbelievably delicious  mole I've ever had and had at least 50+ ingredients in it which is a feat in and of itself).   I am a Mexican-American and learned so much about cooking Mexican food and have impressed so many of my friends and family on my new cooking skills.   I would highly recommend anyone visiting LVB when in Mexico.   It is an extremely memorable experience filled with food, fun and gorgeous atmosphere - and the ultimate joy of eating a 5 star dinner at the end of the day.   Esther from Chicago

195118845.name: The journey, not the destination
195118845.author: a TripAdvisor user
195118845.reviewBody: It is a nice temple, but to get there, you have to climb a challenging mountain terrain path. Once at the pyramid, the city of Tepoztlan sprawls out in front of you. The views are spectacular. It is an amazing experience to climb to this pyramid.

195118467.name: Extreme Hike
195118467.author: a TripAdvisor user
195118467.reviewBody: Tepozteco is an ancient Aztec temple. It is rather small in size, but the journey to it is something to behold. To reach the temple, you have to climb up a very steep and demanding path of rocks, boulders and other challenging terrain. There is a definite path, so it is not hard to find your way to the top. The combination of altitude and intensity made for a challenging climb. If you want an adventure, I highly recommend climbing to the pyramid. The views are spectacular, and you will be glad you put in the effort.

193820747.name: Good hike, good views, average temple
193820747.author: a TripAdvisor user
193820747.reviewBody: Pretty much as lots of other people have said - it\'s a nice hike up to the temple, and a beautiful view. The temple itself is not so exciting, but I wasn\'t expecting it to be and was more interested in the walk. The walk up was fine, and anyone can do it if you take it up at your own speed. Get there earlier in the morning to avoid the haze if you\'re doing it for the views. It\'s 40 something pesos to access the temple at the top. Skip the sandals/flip flops and chuck on some enclosed shoes for the walk.

193189097.name: La Villa Bonita Culinary vacation experience
193189097.author: a TripAdvisor user
193189097.reviewBody: La Villa Bonita is a 6 bedroom casa owned by Robb Anderson and Chef Ana Garcia.  We signed up for the 7 day culinary experience.  During the seven days we had four cooking lessons including going to the market each day to buy fresh ingredients.  Chef Ana is a wonderful teacher and involves everyone in the prepping and cooking process.  Her  beautiful outdoor kitchen is adjacent to the rooms and overlooks the town of Tepoztlan.  We had two extra days to explore the village and nearby Cuernavaca.  Ana speaks beautiful English so language was not a problem.  The staff was courteous and helpful and Mojo their dog was a friendly addition.  I would recommend this experience to anyone who likes to cook and willing to try new dishes and wants to avoid cold weather.  The vacation exceeded my every pre conceived idea of what it would be.  Thanks to Robb and Ana  for making this time great

189161664.name: Not all that exciting
189161664.author: a TripAdvisor user
189161664.reviewBody: The best part about the Pyramid of Tepozteco is the hike up to it.  The actual pyramid itself is interesting, but not the best I\'ve ever seen.  But take the hike and enjoy one of the best experiences of Tepoztlan.

189161592.name: Great Hike and What a View!
189161592.author: a TripAdvisor user
189161592.reviewBody: Hiking up Tepozteco was the highlight of our trip to Tepoztlan.  It\'s not an easy hike\u2026.1300 feet up a very steep path with steps and boulders, but if you\'re in fairly good shape you should have no problem.  We hiked the path on Christmas day and saw hundreds of other people, from the ages of about 2 to 70.  If should take from 45 to 60 minutes to get to the top and when you do you have the reward of an amazing view over the town of Tepoztlan.  There is an old pyramid up here, which you can climb on.  Take a picnic lunch with you, it\'s a nice place for a picnic.  There is no food sold at the top, only drinks.  There is no fee to hike the trail, but to get to the pyramid will cost you $42MP.

189095430.name: Hell of a Hike.
189095430.author: a TripAdvisor user
189095430.reviewBody:
I get it.... the view is breathtaking from atop. However, the climb to the top is intense. I paced myself to get to the top and it was still brutal. The rocks are slippery and you can definitely hurt yourself.

I definitely would not climb this pyramid, again. I do not recommend it if you have asthma or heart problems. +Do take plenty of water and note that there is a fee at the top to enter the small but charming pyramid.

There are pizotes (Coati) hanging out on the top and it is not recommended to pet them. They are very similar to racoons.

The town itself is lovely and charming. I would much rather view the pyramid from afar than to make the trek to get to the top. However, if hiking is your sort of thing... you will love it.

188362515.name: Worth seeing
188362515.author: a TripAdvisor user
188362515.reviewBody: The pyramid is very beautiful and somewhat different from others. But most spectacular is the location atop the Tepozteco Mountain. Sure the historic site is great, but climbing all the way to the top is the kind of feats you can brag about: "Yes! I did it!"

188362324.name: Quite a Hike for an awsome piece of history
188362324.author: a TripAdvisor user
188362324.reviewBody: The climb is very, very tough but it sure is worth it. No stairs, no elevators, no ropes. A steep hike up the hill will take you the the prehispanic pyramid at the top. the view is extraordinary and you can understand why they decided to build up there (besides from the tactical advantage). What is difficult to grasp is how they built it.\nIt\'s worth climbing at least once in a life time.

188140483.name: Difficult to go there but the view is wonderful
188140483.author: a TripAdvisor user
188140483.reviewBody: Whereas it\'s difficult to go up there you really feel proud when you arrive. The pyramid itself is perhaps not worthy the effort but the effort itself and the view are worthy the effort you submit your body.... Take care using the right shoes. Perhaps avoid week-ends. Very nice experience I\'ll certainly repeat....

186857794.name: Amazing experience climbing to the top
186857794.author: a TripAdvisor user
186857794.reviewBody: This is quite the hike. It is totally do-able but by the time I got to the top my thighs were def. sore, which was a great thing because I love to exercise. When you get to the top of the mountain the view is incredible. We felt safe climbing up the entire time because most of the path has stairs, and there are plenty of people. Def. go during the day obviously when it is well lit. One thing that scared me though was that at the top there were the little racoon like animals called Coati. Although they did not hurt me, the local teens were feeding them chips (totally a no-no) and the animals were getting quite aggresive jumping on tourists\' shoulders and also running towards back-packs. If you go just keep food inside your bag and try not to "play" with the wild-life!

184540969.name: A big challenge but not impossible! Amazing!
184540969.author: a TripAdvisor user
184540969.reviewBody: If you are in Tepoztl\u00e1n, you should definitely climb the Tepozteco. Once you make it to the top, you will understand why this is a magical town. The view from there is astonishing! There is a little but very nice piramyd on the very top which you can also climb and sit there for a moment while you rest and contemplate the beautiful landscape. Every step is worth it. You don\'t need any special equipment but a good pair of sneakers. I have climbed it twice with my husband and my 7 year old. My son loves it! I have seen younger kids but I wouldn\'t recommend it for the very little ones or for the very old ones. You can climb it within 1 hour and 30 mins, average. And it takes 45 mins to 1 hour to go down. It depends totally on you. There are some parts with steps, some with only rocks and a couple of big ladders at the last part. Avoid climbing it with rainy weather, it gets very slippery and dangerous. Bring a bottle of water for each, you can only buy it at the bottom or at the top of the mountain. Don\'t bring a lot of things, try to walk light. Bring sunscreen and a cap and try to climb it early (8-9am), after that it gets very hot and very crowded and you will have to wait for people to climb or to go down and that is not fun at all. Charge yourself with good energy! And then have a delicious breakfast! Down the mountain you can have some quesadillas and fresh squeeze orange juice or even a cold beer!

180408878.name: Every sunday hike with a tasty artesanal ice-cream
180408878.author: a TripAdvisor user
180408878.reviewBody:
Well almost every sunday day trip from my hometown CUERNAVACA with family,alone or friends.Love to catch the local bus line saying hola and talking with local people from the nearest towns on the road...Ocotepec,Santa Catharina,Amatlan,etc.
The Bus station in Tepoztlan is not far away from the main square and mercado even is a nice walk on the main street where you can do shopping,drinking or eating also you will see many small chapels(every neighborhood or barrio has one) are very old.
I recommend keep going and start hiking the mountain early so you can avoid tons of people because on sunday is free admission (big market only sunday)
Is better if you take up some snacks & water before or you can buy food on the way up(quesadillas) or spicy beer(micheladas) Mexicans love to hike with one cerveza on the hand...like me haha.
After a funny long metal ladder and more rocky way turns finally THE TOP! my own score is 45 minutes so long from the guys carrying sacks full of sodas & water THEY RUN ALL WAY UP.
Up there you will see on the right the pyramid complex(2 levels) and choose the best spot for lie down and take a long siesta or sit down,drink some water and enjoy THE BEAUTIFUL PANORAMA VIEW then walk around on the top if you want(very safe if you not step on the edge)
Way down is super easy and more if you are thinking in food!! the local mercado is located on a square near the cathedral where you can have a lot of tasty real MEXICAN FOOD.
A nice restaurant on the way back from Tepozteco: Los Colorines (you should try on the menu Huaxontles)
After being satisfied is time for Tepoznieves! the famous one artesanal ice-cream in Tepoztlan;they mix seasonal fruits and flowers too!
Local buses to Cuernavaca stop running around 830pm if you miss the last one,there are nice guesthouses where you can stay and maybe by night spot few UFO's...this town is very famous for that.
See you on my way back Tepozteco
happy travels
betour

180210984.name: Good hike
180210984.author: a TripAdvisor user
180210984.reviewBody: This is a good hike. The pyramid itself is not as impressive as others in mexico but the hike up makes a great day outting. It is a bit steep especially in some areas but many children, families and even women in heels are climbing so it keeps you motivated :) i would recommend it, we plan to go again soon as a day trip from DF

178200940.name: hope you are in good physical shape
178200940.author: a TripAdvisor user
178200940.reviewBody: Went there during the year 2016. The way up is hard, but its pretty enjoyable, entertaining, the landscape is impressive, you could spend hours up there, watching the pyramid, and the town of Tepoztlan downstairs, its just beautiful! Make sure to take plenty of water in your backpack. The food at town is good, and very cheap!

174220389.name: Tepozteco
174220389.author: a TripAdvisor user
174220389.reviewBody: its worth going up the hill unless its raining. the food around the tepozteco is inexpensive and very good.safe to walk around town.\nthe view from the top of the hill is Amazing and locals are very nice people

171810249.name: A climb for the fit, with a great view at the top
171810249.author: a TripAdvisor user
171810249.reviewBody: The Tepozteco is a small Pyramid at the top of a mountain that overlooks the town of Tepoztlan in the State of Morelos just off of the major Highway to Mexico City. The trail up is well marked. Bring plenty of water and take frequent breaks if you don\'t climb hills and mountains on a regular basis. Make sure you have very comfortable shoes or boots especially if you are prone to blisters. The view at from the top overlooking the Valley of Morelos is worth the climb.

170317715.name: Quiet, but colorful and festive
170317715.author: a TripAdvisor user
170317715.reviewBody: A very charming town, with lots of local color and terrific restaurants.  The city sits in a valley surrounded by lovely mountains.  The marketplace is bustling and fun and the hike up to the pyramid is daunting, but thrilling.

162458677.name: Go early and avoid the heat!
162458677.author: a TripAdvisor user
162458677.reviewBody: We went some friends that are local to Cuernavaca and had a blast! We left Cuernavaca around 7:30 am during the week, stopped at the plaza market in Tepotzlan to have tamales y atole, and then started climbing! The climb was great: well-marked, with rustic rock-stairs, and shaded. There were ample places to stop and rest. I recommend going during the week so that you aren\'t competing for space with locals who go there for exercise on the weekends. Take water and money to pay to get in at the top so that you can climb onto the pyramid and snap some great shots. Oh! And there are no bathrooms, so keep that in mind. :)\nOnce you\'re done, don\'t forget to visit Tepoznieves in the town. They have AMAZING icecreams in all kinds of flavors! Don\'t miss it!

162197936.name: Great hike, even better view
162197936.author: a TripAdvisor user
162197936.reviewBody: Lovely place, very green. Deasant hike offering absolutely fantasic views, would advise going on a clear day if you have the chance.

155066580.name: EVERY weekend for 4 years!
155066580.author: a TripAdvisor user
155066580.reviewBody: Tepotzlan is a colonial village outside of Cuernavaca. The streets are narrow & cobblestone. We loved visiting the pyramid & sipping cafe\' con leche in the Square (Zocalo). The climb up to the pyramid is1,000 meters, straight up...ruins & awesome view of the valley.

153548542.name: Worth the hike
153548542.author: a TripAdvisor user
153548542.reviewBody: Do not get discouraged.  Climbing to the pyramid can be quite the challenge, especially with the altitude, but they have done a nice job with the rocks along the way and you can access the place without a problem.  There are 4 trenches, the first one is the longest.  The last requires you to go up some metal stairs with railing that are a far cry of what used to be there before.  once you summit, you must pay 42 pesos to actually climb the pyramid.  There are no signs at the bottom that tell you about it, so be prepared.  But do contribute because once you climb the small pyramid, you feel your body filling up with energy and replenishing itself.  the views of the town and mountains are phenomenal.  There is even a little store up there- yup they have to follow the same route to bring up their supplies, quite remarkable.  You will most likely see some "tejones"  - raccoon looking like animals more interested in food than us...unless you have food to offer.  Your energy filled body will make the descent in no time.

152298930.name: Not for the feint hearted
152298930.author: a TripAdvisor user
152298930.reviewBody: A very strenuous climb but loads of places to stop and take a breath. Pyramid not the best but the views and sense of achievement are second to none

150075952.name: Hike up Tepozteco
150075952.author: a TripAdvisor user
150075952.reviewBody: Loved this hike - pretty trail, challenging climb, great views.  We appreciated the ice cream vendors we found on our way back into town.

147088154.name: Alternative to Cuernavaca\u2019s Busy-ness
147088154.author: a TripAdvisor user
147088154.reviewBody:
Wanting some greenery, we took a  twenty minute taxi ride from Cuernavaca to Tepotzlan.  The climb to Tepozteco starts just a short walk from the town.  We had a fairly dramatic climb on stone steps to the small pyramid that rises two kilometers above the town.  Believe me, it’s worth it.  Make sure you have good shoes, and that you are in good shape.  If not, you can pace your climb.  We were told it would take anywhere from 40 minutes to one half day to reach the summit.  It took us two hours.   Along the way, we experienced dramatic greenery, butterflies and birds, and (it must be said) some weird sounds in the wind that seem to confirm that Tepotztlan is a magical town.

When you come to the top, you must pay a small fee (43 pesos per person) when we did it) to climb the pyramid.  What an amazing experience to stand at its summit, see the glyphs carved into the rock, or gaze into the valley far below.  You will have the sensation of having stepped back in time 400 years.

One last thing; you may see coatis at the summit and they may mooch for food.  It is neither permitted, nor wise to feed them.

146379966.name: Tepozteco Pyramid
146379966.author: a TripAdvisor user
146379966.reviewBody:
a beautiful hike – a kilometre and a half from the base of the mountain – up to the ziggurat above Tepoztlán.

the pyramid's not so much to look at, but wonderful to emerge into warm sun, look out over the valley, watch the tahoes (dog-monkey creatures foraging everywhere, not sure how to spell it), think about how long people have been here – and enjoy the modest triumph of climbing 400 metres from a starting point already at 2100 m.

i'd do it again – crazy Texan who caught up to us had climbed it on four consecutive mornings... 42 pesos entry.

127255349.name: Terpozteco temple
127255349.author: a TripAdvisor user
127255349.reviewBody: Same as above- Tepozteco is the name of the pyramid. Overlooks the town. Well marked by Mexico\'s equivalent of the National Parks.

127255286.name: The temple of Tepozteco
127255286.author: a TripAdvisor user
127255286.reviewBody: incredible view, a strenuous hike but not too strenuous.

127095644.name: Fabulous market of local items.
127095644.author: a TripAdvisor user
127095644.reviewBody: On the weekend there\'s a market featuring tons of food, local produce and things for your home, apparel, jewelry, etc.  We brought nuts back to our room for snacks and had a great lunch, cheaper than the restaurants.

126968285.name: Whew!
126968285.author: a TripAdvisor user
126968285.reviewBody: What a climb! Harder than I expected as you are mostly climbing on uneven rocks but still worth the effort. A nice cold cerveza afterward made it ok!

126570711.name: good  for those liking treeking
126570711.author: a TripAdvisor user
126570711.reviewBody: The  trek is nice and the views from the top wonderful.  Just for fitted people!

125669357.name: It\'s a nice place to visit if you have the time and the energy...
125669357.author: a TripAdvisor user
125669357.reviewBody: It\'s a nice place to visit if you have the means to get to the city and the time to go up to see the pyramid. The way up is much more difficult than people usually tell you and the way down is not much easier. It might take longer than the official 45minutes to get there. The pyramid is nice but the view is not so great. Having comfortable shoes is crucial as well as taking with you some water (maybe a light snack too). In my opinion it\'s not appropriate to children (under 8) not to elders who are not in very good shape. The hike itself is more exciting than the archaeological attraction.

125260730.name: To The Top
125260730.author: a TripAdvisor user
125260730.reviewBody: This was good strenuous exercise, I don\'t advise doing until you have adjusted to the altitude otherwise you will regret it. Keep a steady pace and you\'ll have a great view of the area. Pat yourself on the back when you make it to the top. Take water with you.

124714437.name: A nice Hike rewarded by a nice view
124714437.author: a TripAdvisor user
124714437.reviewBody:
Started climbing around 8am, in February, We were on our own for most of the ascent, only running into loccals doing their daily exercice. 
The path up is very nice and worth the effort, very rocky though so trainers are the minimum to be safe. Go early in the morning to avoid heat, bring some water (at least a 1l bottle per person) you can purchase some more at the top. 

The pyramid isn't very interesting, go for the view. 

The Pyramid grounds at the top only open at 9am, so we had to wait for 20 minutes there. 

Don't forget to take 45 pesos per person to pay the entrance at the top.

123860269.name: A short but steep hike up to the pyramid
123860269.author: a TripAdvisor user
123860269.reviewBody: The path is well prepared with steps most of the way. The Pyramid on the top is not large but it must have been quite some work to build it. The view of the town and surroundings is very good. There is a possibility to get water and refreshments at the top and we had to pay an entrance fee  of 40pesos per adult to walk up on the pyramid.  \nMake sure you have good shoes and bring along water for the hike. If it is raining or wet I believe the steps may be quite slippery.

122898541.name: Good excercise especially if you are not used to the high elevation
122898541.author: a TripAdvisor user
122898541.reviewBody: It is a small town, peaceful, you find good food en los Ciruelos, Good coffee, papaya, bread,  etc.

121897061.name: must see
121897061.author: a TripAdvisor user
121897061.reviewBody: amazing veiws must do when come here. If u go on sunday its free (other wise 34 pesos each :)

121468490.name: Aerobic climb, great view, average pyramid
121468490.author: a TripAdvisor user
121468490.reviewBody: I knew the climb to the top of Tepozteco was intense, but it was more than I expected.  I am in average shape and was able to climb with out major difficulty.  It still took a good 45 minutes to reach the top with various portions of rocky terrain.   You will definitely want to bring water and wear comfortable hiking shoes (I couldn\'t believe all the people who wore sandals or high heels!)  \n\nOnce you catch your breath at the end of the very steep climb, glance up for an amazing view of the valley below.  I imagine that at day break or sunset it would be lovely, but I was there about mid-day.  If you are interested in archaeology, the pyramid is not spectacular and is mostly reconstructed (probably for tourism\'s sake).  I still recommend the hike as it is a beautiful adventure through the forest.   Try to go early, especially on the weekend, when many people decide to climb and the path becomes crowded.  Admission is free on Sundays for both nationals and foreigners!

121087235.name: lovely, safe town with nice people
121087235.author: a TripAdvisor user
121087235.reviewBody: lovely, picturese town, the real mexico... clean, great market, great shopping

105149270.name: Worth the 2 km of hike.
105149270.author: a TripAdvisor user
105149270.reviewBody:
First of all if you are planning to hike and see the pyramid take these recommendations.
1. GO EARLY, if you go after 12:00 expect really large amounts of sweaty people. If you can start at 10:00 or even before it's better.
2. Buy water but not too much. There is water at the top.
3. Be careful while going down.
4. Bring 35 pesos per person 

It's a great trip but not for everyone.

65313316.name: Well worth the Effort
65313316.author: a TripAdvisor user
65313316.reviewBody:
Short walk along the main road out to the edge of town and the climb begins.  We were there for a weekend mid-May and did the climb after a too heavy lunch and at the hottest time of the day !!  A lot of the path has been made into steps but there are parts which are simply rocks to clamber up.  We are a  “mature”, reasonably fit couple and needed frequent stops for water and a rest but reached the top in 1 hour 20 minutes.  Quite a lot of other people on the way up and down so much good natured banter about fitness levels and distance still to go.
The pyramid at the top is small and rather disappointing by general pyramid standards in Mexico but the views down into town and of the surrounding hills are well-worth the trek.
There is a tienda at the top to replenish liquid supplies and a place to pay 41 pesos to access the pyramid.  There is also a pack of quarrelsome coatis pestering you for tidbits in defiance of the no feeding signs.
Felt we had earned a beer when we finally arrived back at the bottom  !!

21980021.name: Enjoy it a lot
21980021.author: a TripAdvisor user
21980021.reviewBody:
Tepoztlan is a great place, we arrived there around 12:00pm and started to climb at 12:45, it took us around 1:30 minutes to get to the top. All the way is climbing mostly over rocks. My party was 2 kids (7 and 3) and my wife, my 7 years old had no problem to climb actually she was the one leading us, for my 3 years old son it was a little difficult, IMHO I think he was too young but anyway he climbed till the end with little help.

At the top, the view is great, there is no more to do except for enjoying the view. 

There were lots of people and actually we had to do a 40 minutes queue in order to get down, this is because the upper part of the mountain is very narrow and only one person can pass at the time so there was conflict between the people that is climbing and the people that is descending, except for that, the place was great.
